Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ITsPeople

ITsPeople is a leading management and consulting firm specializing in guiding organizations through complex digital transformations and enhancing their organizational agility. We empower our clients to navigate and overcome intricate business challenges by leveraging data-driven insights and managing large-scale transformation projects. Our mission is to help companies strengthen their market position by adopting advanced data analytics and AI, fostering a culture of agility, and driving sustained operational excellence.




Role Overview

As a Data Scientist at ITsPeople, you will be instrumental in transforming data into actionable insights that support our clients' strategic objectives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex problems, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven decision-making. This role is ideal for a highly analytical individual with a passion for uncovering patterns and insights from large datasets and communicating these findings effectively.




Key Responsibilities

Data Collection and Preparation: Gather, clean, and prepare large datasets from various sources for analysis, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Conduct exploratory analyses to discover trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing valuable insights to stakeholders.
Predictive and Diagnostic Modeling: Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models and algorithms to predict outcomes and diagnose issues.
Machine Learning and AI: Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to build models that address business challenges and optimize processes.
Data Visualization and Reporting: Develop impactful visualizations and write comprehensive advisory reports to effectively communicate data insights and support informed decision-making.
Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with project teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and domain experts, to understand requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data science and technology to continually improve methodologies and tools.




Required Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: 1-5 years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role. We welcome enthusiastic individuals looking to start or advance their career in data science.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming (Python), ETL processes (SQL), and data processing with tools like Jupyter Notebook, Databricks, and Tableau. Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks and advanced statistics. Experience with MATLAB, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, or similar tools and modules is a plus.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively within teams.
Language skills: Fluency in Dutch and English is required.




Personal Attributes

Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Detail Oriented: Attention to detail in data analysis, modeling, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all deliverables.
Proactive and Driven: Self-motivated and proactive in seeking out new challenges and opportunities to apply data science.
Team Player: Collaborative spirit with the ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
Personal Leadership: Demonstrates initiative, responsibility, and the ability to lead and inspire others without formal authority.




Training and Development

At ITsPeople, we believe in the growth and development of our team members. We offer a robust training program designed to equip new and emerging professionals with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in their roles. Our comprehensive training covers the latest in data science techniques, tools, and industry best practices, providing you with the foundation to succeed and grow within our dynamic team.




Why Join ITsPeople?

Joining ITsPeople means being part of a vibrant and supportive team dedicated to driving transformative change for our clients through data-driven solutions. We value innovation, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on high-impact projects, engage with a diverse range of clients, and contribute significantly to their success.




We offer a stimulating work environment that promotes professional development and personal growth. You will have the autonomy to manage your projects, collaborate with senior consultants, and play a key role in our data-driven strategies.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about constructing AI systems that unlock predictive insights at an unprecedented scale? Can you design and implement solutions using cutting-edge LLM and deep learning technologies? Don't hesitate—apply now!

In a nutshell


Hop on a journey with an exciting fast-growing SaaS company in an international environment (steep learning curve is guaranteed).
Secure an impactful role with lots of growth potential for yourself.
Spearhead innovative initiatives on the intersection of AI/ML and NLP.
Develop scalable and accurate AI models that deliver predictive insights beyond human capacity.
Join a team of diverse and passionate people with a culture that empowers great work (15 ninjas & 10 nationalities).
Enjoy a lot of perks: Flexible working hours & unlimited holiday policy, attractive office in Amsterdam, visa sponsorship, mentorship program, own laptop & home equipment, team events & games... (and more!).



🧑‍💻 What are we doing?

At Kaizo, we're not just building a platform - we're creating a dynamic ecosystem that actively guides employees to achieve their goals and make a lasting impact on their organizations. Our focus is on revolutionizing the daily work experience for customer support teams through a performance development and compliance platform that combines cutting-edge AI technologies with gamification.


AI-Powered Engagement: We're leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies to improve operational efficiency, enhance team performance, and provide unparalleled performance visibility. Our goal is to make the daily work experience more engaging, fun, and productive for customer support agents, quality assurance professionals, and team leaders.
Stream Processing Excellence: Built on a microservices-based stream processing platform, we process over 200 million events per day using cutting-edge technologies such as Akka Streams and Kafka. Our services, deployed on Kubernetes in Google Cloud, seamlessly feed data into ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and Google BigQuery.
Developing the Future: Our team is at the forefront of developing AI systems that are not only scalable, affordable, and interpretable but also flexible and empowering. We're pursuing real-time solutions that redefine the way compliance monitoring is done.
Our journey is not without its challenges, and we embrace them as opportunities for innovation:
Scalability Quest: Processing approximately 10 tickets per second requires solutions with lightning-fast inference speeds. We're working on LLMs that match GPT's accuracy but operate at an unparalleled speed.
Cost Efficiency Mandate: Dealing with large ticket volumes requires economically feasible solutions that do not scale linearly in terms of cost with the expected volume. We're on a mission to optimize efficiency and resource utilization.
Accuracy Triumph: Our compliance engine aims for maximum accuracy while maintaining a conservative approach to predictions.
Data Privacy Conundrum: The presence of sensitive PII in our customers' data adds a layer of complexity. We're addressing the challenge of fine-tuning models on raw data while upholding the highest standards of data privacy and security.
Data Diversity Voyage: Dealing with diverse data formats, from text and raw speech to metadata and tabular data, presents its own set of challenges. We navigate this diversity to ensure our solutions are adaptable and comprehensive.



🗓️ What are your 12 labours here?

As a Data Scientist, you will help us implement new features into our product by building and deploying production-grade models that leverage state-of-the-art technologies. Your primary focus will be on developing high quality prediction models that can be integrated with our services, performing statistical analysis, designing scalable AI systems using innovative architecture.

🤖 You will focus on


NLP and NLG using state-of-the-art methods
Improving and extending the features used by our existing systems
Processing, cleaning, and aggregating data used for analysis
Performing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Creating automated systems and tracking their performance
Building and optimising prediction systems using open source and proprietary LLMs
Collaborating with other team-members within the company to drive product development
Communicating results and ideas to key decision makers
Experimenting with different tools and technologies, and evaluate new data science approaches for the business



🧑‍💻 What you bring to the table?


3+ years industry experience
Experience in prototyping and deploying at least one data science project to a production environment
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn and Jupyter Notebooks
Experience with one of the following: Tensorflow, PyTorch, or any other deep learning/machine learning framework
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Dash, Seaborn, D3, etc
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills using Python
Familiarity with MLOps is a plus.
Experience in using one or more of the following tools and technologies is a plus: Google Cloud Platform, Github, Docker, Kubernetes, MongoDB, ElasticSearch
Data-oriented personality
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Being part of an early stage startup, we sometimes need you to wear multiple hats just to keep things going, hence being a team player is a must have.



🏆 What’s in it for you?


An office right in the heart of Amsterdam, complemented by the flexibility of hybrid working
Visa sponsorship available for eligible candidates
Great office gear: MacBook, tools, desks, chair — there’s something for everyone
The freedom of a flexible working schedule
Fun workations & open holiday policy
Show more

  • Being part of an early stage startup, we sometimes need you to wear multiple hats just to keep things going, hence being a team player is a must have.


🏆 What’s in it for you?

  • An office right in the heart of Amsterdam, complemented by the flexibility of hybrid working
  • Visa sponsorship available for eligible candidates
  • Great office gear: MacBook, tools, desks, chair — there’s something for everyone
  • The freedom of a flexible working schedule

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.

We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.

The Role

As a Data Scientist at Zeno, your mission is to turn raw data into powerful insights that revolutionize how legal professionals search, analyze, and interact with legal information. You’ll work at the intersection of AI, search technology, and data science—uncovering hidden patterns, refining algorithms, and enhancing our search capabilities to deliver the most relevant and precise results.

This is a unique opportunity to work on deeply challenging problems, shape a high-impact product, and push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the legal field.

What You’ll Work On


Improve retrieval accuracy, ranking, and relevance using AI-driven approaches.
Identify patterns, extract insights, and refine datasets to improve our platform’s intelligence.
Build and test models that enhance search, document classification, and legal data analysis.
Ensure our datasets are clean, structured, and optimized for AI processing.
Work closely with software engineers, data architects, and domain experts to implement solutions that directly impact our users.
Explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies to keep Zeno at the forefront of AI-driven legal tech.


What We’re Looking For


You love working with data, uncovering insights, and optimizing algorithms to drive meaningful results.
You are skilled in Python and have experience working with AI frameworks, search technologies, graph data science, or NLP.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.


What We Offer


A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.


Let’s shape the future of legal work together
Show more

  • You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
  • You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.

What We Offer

  • A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
  • The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
  • An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
  • Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
  • Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.

Let’s shape the future of legal work together

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Through your machine learning solutions, you create simplified processes for our customers and help us establish ourselves as 'digital first'.

With a solution-oriented and active mindset, you come up with technical solutions, using AI models. Through your solutions, the data team and the AI team create more business value. In addition to creating business value, knowledge transfer and coaching are also an important part of your job. The goal is to take the engineering skills of your fellow data scientists to the next level, among other things by following best practices.

What you are going to do

You are able to take the lead in devising and designing AI-driven applications. We are currently mainly building state-of-the-art applications with (OpenAI's GPT) LLMs. An important point of attention here is that everything is secure, scalable and repeatable. You will work closely with the Data Scientists to improve the Machine Learning Lifecycle. The focus is on code quality, CI/CD, testing and monitoring. Security is an important part of your application and you are aware of the compliance rules within NN. If you would love to experience an overlap of AI, Software and Data Engineering in your work, then this is your place.


You will further develop a platform solution that is able to classify incoming emails and attachments at scale
You bring AI models (data products) to production, for example in the form of APIs
You develop and maintain the machine learning infrastructure, fitting into the NN landscape
You develop AI applications based on CI/CD, high-quality code, testing and monitoring


What we offer you

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:


Salary between €4,414 and €6,306 depending on your knowledge and experience This is based on 40 hours per week. It’s also possible to work 36 or 38 hours per week.
13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
A modern pension administered by BeFrank
Plenty of training and learning opportunities
NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled
Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use


Who you are

You find it important to bring well-designed applications to production with low maintenance. Furthermore, you enjoy sharing your knowledge with others. You like to take the time to take your colleagues along in your steps and explain things to them. Your open attitude and strong communication skills help enormously with this. Good command of the Dutch language is preferred and you currently reside in the Netherlands. Furthermore, you have:


A bachelor's or master's degree in IT or a study with a strong IT component, with at least 3 years of work experience
Experience in the field of Software/DevOps engineering and developing ML applications
Working knowledge of the data science process, such as data collection, cleaning, model review, and model implementation
Experience in developing (Flask) APIs, Azure Function Apps and CI/CD
Experience with building applications in the Azure Cloud, Docker & Terraform


Who you will work with

You will be working in our Competence Center, where we work on applications for the business through projects. Your team includes data scientists and machine learning engineers. We also work with various end-to-end teams, all of which exchange specialist knowledge. In this way, we work very efficiently on scalable solutions. In this process, we learn a lot from each other. Our ambition is to become even better at AI.

Together we work on state-of-the-art solutions, in Python and in the (Azure) cloud. In your work, you experience a lot of freedom and responsibility. That ensures that you continue to grow. In the team we work hybrid, where we meet together at the office at least once a week.

Any questions?

If you have any questions about the job or recruitment process, you can reach out via email to Hilde Diemel, Talent Acquisition Specialist via hilde.diemel@nn-group.com.

We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken
27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag
13e maand en vakantiegeld
Hybride werken
Show more

Title: Research Engineer - Machine Learning
Description:
Our client, a leading Algorithmic Trading firm, are hiring a machine learning engineer to work alongside a Quantitative Trader who has recently joined the firm.




Responsibilities:

Developing data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing diverse datasets.
Design and implement deep learning architectures for large volumes of data.
Conduct experiments and tests to evaluate model performance.
Contribute to optimizing and fine-tuning existing machine learning models.
Build pipelines for monitoring, managing and constantly improving production ML/DL models.




Qualifications:

A bachelors, masters, or PhD (complete) degree or equivalent from a top university, with 2-6 years of experience.
Prior experience with training, building, and deploying large scale deep learning models is mandatory.
Prior experience designing and implementing sequence and time series models is required.
Experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines and MLOps for automating model deployments.
Skilled in using Linux, SQL, Git, and BASH scripting.
Strong knowledge of Python and hands-on (Pytorch/Tensorflow).




For more info, apply below or email Tom via tom@qenexus.com

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Amsterdam, 2 days per week in the office




About our Team




LexisNexis Legal & Professional, which serves customers in more than 150 countries with 11,800 employees worldwide, is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. Our company has been a long-time leader in deploying AI and advanced technologies to the legal market to improve productivity and transform the overall business and practice of law, deploying ethical and powerful generative AI solutions with a flexible, multi-model approach that prioritizes using the best model from today’s top model creators for each individual legal use case.




About the Role




As a Data Scientist, you will extract insights from large, complex datasets using diverse analysis techniques. You'll use data preparation, modeling, and visualization to solve intricate business problems.




Extracts knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data in order to investigate complex business problems through a range of data preparation, modeling, analysis and/or visualization techniques, which may include statistical analysis, predictive modeling and pattern recognition | Typically uses existing data platforms and tools (ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases, data analysis and visualization software) but may also use object-oriented programming to develop own scripts and visualizations.




A Data Scientist II should have a basic understanding of best-practice and can execute the methods for projects with supervision. Individuals in this role will continue to provide support to the Data Scientist team members and also begin to lead some analytic efforts.







Responsibilities




Extracting knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data
Investigating complex business problems through data preparation, modeling, and analysis
Utilizing statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and pattern recognition techniques
Using existing data platforms and tools for data analysis and visualization
Developing own scripts and visualizations using object-oriented programming
Providing support to senior Data Scientists and leading some analytic efforts
Pulling data, cleaning data, and maintaining datasets and models
Participating in result presentation to internal stakeholders




Requirements




Hold at least a bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Have a solid background of relevant work experience or a master's degree in a related field.
Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software




Work in a way that works for you




We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you




We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




Dutch Share Purchase Plan
Annual Profit Share Bonus
Comprehensive Pension Plan
Home, office or commuting allowance
Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
Flexible working hours
Personal Choice budget
Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
Internal communities and networks
Various employee discounts
Recruitment introduction reward
Work from anywhere
Employee Assistance Program (global)
Annual Event




About the Business




LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Als Data Scientist krijg je de kans om vooraan te staan in de wereld van kunstmatige intelligentie. Je ontwikkelt slimme AI-oplossingen en werkt met generatieve modellen om innovatieve resultaten te behalen voor de organisatie. Of je nu net begint of al ervaring hebt, jouw bijdrage maakt een echte impact. Kom werken in een team waar jouw ideeën en expertise écht gewaardeerd worden!


Jouw job

Ben jij gepassioneerd door technologie en wil je bijdragen aan innovatieve AI-oplossingen? Als Data Scientist speel je een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen, implementeren en verbeteren van AI-gedreven oplossingen die het verschil maken binnen onze organisatie. Jij helpt generatieve AI-modellen tot leven te brengen door middel van slimme prompt engineering, zodat deze effectief kunnen bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelen. Wat ga je doen?


  • Ontwerpen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning en AI-oplossingen, waaronder generatieve AI-modellen. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het bouwen van end-to-end producten die AI-modellen voeden met schone, gestructureerde en relevante data en deze beschikbaar maken voor frontendsystemen. Daarnaast werk je nauw samen met stakeholders om de ontwikkeling van AI-modellen en AI-gedreven applicaties te faciliteren en optimaliseren.
  • Prompt engineering: jij ontwikkelt en verfijnt prompts om AI-modellen optimaal te sturen, zodat ze precies doen wat ze moeten doen.
  • Samenwerken met diverse teams: je werkt nauw samen met zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders om AI-oplossingen te creëren die perfect aansluiten bij de behoeften van de business.
  • Innovatie: je onderzoekt en past de nieuwste AI-methoden toe, met een focus op het verbeteren van prompt engineering voor maximale.
  • Documentatie: Je schrijft en onderhoudt duidelijke technische documentatie, zodat je werk voor iedereen begrijpelijk is.


Locatie/ Team

Bij Veldsink krijg je de kans om écht het verschil te maken. Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën in een omgeving die continu in beweging is. Flexibiliteit, innovatie, en samenwerking staan bij ons centraal, en we bieden je volop mogelijkheden om je verder te ontwikkelen.


Je werkt 32-40 uur, rapporteert aan de manager Data & Analyse op onze Veldsink Campus in Nuenen, vlakbij Eindhoven. Een bruisende, frisse omgeving, licht zakelijk maar zeker ook huiselijk. Eenmaal binnengekomen staan de koffieautomaat en je collega’s klaar om je dag goed te laten beginnen. Welkom!


Wat maakt jou die unieke collega?

  • Afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in Computer Science, AI of Data Science;
  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist, met nadruk op AI;
  • Ervaring met AI-oplossingen, waaronder machine learning en generatieve AI-modellen;
  • Kennis van Azure, Azure DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes en OpenAI-platforms;
  • Programmeren in Python, waarbij kennis van AI-frameworks zoals LangChain een voordeel is;
  • Ervaring met Flask of andere Python-webframeworks;
  • Je hebt overtuigingskracht, bent besluitvaardig en hebt een probleemoplossend vermogen.
  • Je bent goed in stakeholdermanagement en vindt het leuk om AI-concepten uit te leggen aan jouw stakeholders.


Wat bieden wij jou?

Bij Veldsink Groep vinden we jouw groei belangrijk. Via de Veldsink Academy faciliteren we jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling. We waarderen jouw kwaliteiten en willen van je leren, terwijl we je tegelijkertijd ondersteunen met onze kennis en expertise. We investeren in jou als persoon en collega, met het oog op een langdurige samenwerking.


Naast je salaris krijg je een goede pensioensregeling, waarvan wij 2/3 betalen;

  • 29 vakantiedagen o.b.v. een fulltime dienstverband en de mogelijkheid om 5 dagen bij te kopen;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding (>10 km);
  • De Veldsink Academy voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling;
  • De mogelijkheid om thuis te werken met daarbij een thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • Voordeliger sporten;
  • Fietsplan: voordelig een (elektrische) fiets leasen;
  • Gezellige bedrijfsfeestjes.


Interesse?

Klaar om impact te maken met AI? Solliciteer nu en word een sleutelspeler in de toekomst van technologie!

Dan kijken we uit naar jouw sollicitatie en mag je jouw cv sturen naar marieke.hendriks@veldsinkgroep.nl t.a.v. Marieke Hendriks.


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Experience And Education

Essential Qualifications/Experience:


Strong understanding of machine learning concepts, statistical analysis techniques and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Hands-on experience in programming, machine learning and software engineering.
Application of state-of-the-art data science and analytical tools and relevant programming languages (python with its Data Science frameworks, e/g/ pytorch/tensorflow, huggingface, langchain, autogen, pandas/polars, pySpark, scikit-learn…)
Additionally, at least 3 of the following items to be met:


ü Experience with developing, optimizing and maintaining AI pipelines

ü Experience in measuring model performance and assessments

ü Experience in using and applying the pre-trained machine learning models (for example Generative AI) for specific use case

ü Experience with Version Control, MLOps (train, package, deploy, monitor) and CI/CD

ü Experience with container technologies (e.g. Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes)

ü Experience with workflow orchestration (e.g. Airflow, Argo etc.)

ü Experience with REST API development

ü Experience with front-end development

Duties/Role


Applies existing machine learning techniques to new problems and datasets
Evaluates the outcomes and performance of machine learning systems
Identifies issues and recommends improvements to machine learning systems and the data they use. Programming
Designs, codes, verifies, tests, documents, amends and refactors moderately complex programs/scripts
Applies agreed standards and tools to achieve a well-engineered result
Monitors and reports on progress
Identifies issues related to ML development activities
Proposes practical ML solutions to resolve issues
Collaborates in reviews of work with others as appropriate. Systems and software / ML life cycle engineering
Elicits requirements for systems and software / ML life cycle working practices and automation
Selects systems and software / ML life cycle working practices for components and micro-services
Deploys automation to achieve well-engineered and secure outcomes. Systems integration and build
Defines the ML modules needed for an integration build and produces a build definition for each generation of the solution
Accepts completed ML modules, ensuring that they meet defined criteria. Data science
Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques.
Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models
Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use. Data engineering
Applies data engineering standards and tools to create and maintain data pipelines and extract, transform and load data. Emerging technology monitoring
Supports monitoring of the external environment and assessment of emerging technologies
Contributes to the creation of reports, technology road mapping and the sharing of knowledge and insights
Show more

Title: Front-end Developer
HTML:
Sogeti staat bekend om zijn uitstekende werksfeer en een cultuur waar hiërarchie tot een minimum beperkt is. Als Front-end Developer bij ons team stap je in een dynamische omgeving waarin je samen met enthousiaste collega’s werkt aan uitdagende IT-projecten. Onze vestiging in Groningen bruist van energie dankzij een snelgroeiende groep professionals die passie hebben voor hun vak, iets wat je direct voelt op de werkvloer. Werken bij Sogeti Noordoost betekent werken voor een diverse klantenkring, wat van jou de nodige flexibiliteit vraagt. Dit biedt echter ook de kans om elke dag iets nieuws te leren en zorgt ervoor dat geen dag hetzelfde is. Daarnaast krijg je volop de kans om jezelf te certificeren. We organiseren regelmatig technische Meet-ups en stimuleren kennisdeling waar iedereen, zowel binnen als buiten Sogeti, van harte welkom is. Bij Sogeti ondersteunen we elkaar, hebben we plezier in ons werk, en behalen we samen de beste resultaten!

Werken als Front-end Developer bij Sogeti

Je gaat aan de slag met de technische realisatie van frontend (web)applicaties binnen diverse opdrachten voor Sogeti’s klanten. Dit kan zowel op locatie bij de klant als intern bij Sogeti. Je hebt een passie voor het ontwerpen en implementeren van responsive (web)apps en zet hiervoor jouw uitgebreide kennis en ervaring in. Uiteraard ben je voortdurend bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling, waarbij je continu op de hoogte blijft van de nieuwste technologieën.

Je bent creatief, hebt een scherp oog voor gebruikersinteractie, en bent een developer in hart en nieren. Met jouw klantgerichte en initiatiefrijke houding beschik je precies over de kwaliteiten die een Frontend Developer nodig heeft.

Binnen Sogeti maak je deel uit van de Interaction-community, waar jouw kennis een belangrijke bijdrage levert. Heb je bepaalde certificeringen nog niet op zak? Geen zorgen, Sogeti ondersteunt je in het behalen hiervan en biedt ruime opleidingsmogelijkheden. Daarnaast kun je technische meetings, beurzen en evenementen bijwonen. Er is volop ruimte voor jouw eigen ideeën en initiatieven, die niet alleen gewaardeerd maar ook beloond worden! Zo draag jij bij aan het succes van onze community.

Wonen en werken in Noordoost-Nederland

Bij Sogeti begrijpen we hoe belangrijk het is om te werken in de regio waar je woont. In Noordoost-Nederland kun je aan de slag bij onze regiovestiging in Groningen, waar we ervoor zorgen dat jouw reistijd beperkt blijft door slim klantbeheer en mogelijkheden voor werken op afstand. Bij onze locatie in Groningen vind je alle disciplines onder één dak, waardoor je gemakkelijk kunt samenwerken met collega’s en projectmatig kunt werken. Onze opdrachtgevers komen uit diverse sectoren, wat zorgt voor afwisselend en boeiend werk. Als voorstander van hybride werken, stimuleren we ook (deels) thuiswerken.

Een echte Sogetist is een vakspecialist met passie en plezier! We staan altijd klaar voor elkaar, en samen behalen we de mooiste resultaten!

Wie ben jij?

Ben jij een front-end developer die klaar is voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Wij zoeken iemand die met passie en expertise ons team wil versterken.

  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met front-end development;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met moderne FrontEnd frameworks, bij voorkeur Angular;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Agile en Scrum werkwijzen;
  • Uitgebreide kennis van HTML5 en CSS3;
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met NodeJS en NPM;
  • HBO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Je neemt initiatief, bent communicatief sterk en werkt graag samen.

Klinkt dit als jouw volgende stap? Solliciteer nu en word onderdeel van ons enthousiaste team!

Dit bieden wij jou

Op zoek naar een baan waar je je volop kunt ontwikkelen én genieten van een prettige werksfeer? Bij ons krijg je precies dat en meer!

  • Salaris tot € 5.000,-- bruto per maand;
  • Werken aan mooie opdrachten bij top 200 klanten;
  • Direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;
  • Een ruim aanbod van opleidingen en trainingen om je IT-kennis en soft-skills te verbeteren;
  • Een actieve Interaction community, waarbij je collega's je sparringpartners zijn;
  • Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder meer dan 25 vakantiedagen;
  • Een fijne werkomgeving met een ontspannen sfeer;
  • Standplaats Groningen.

Klaar om de sprong te wagen? Solliciteer vandaag nog en bouw mee aan onze toekomst!

You make technology work. Solliciteer als Front-end Developer!

Ben je geïnteresseerd? Solliciteer dan op de functie van Frontend Developer en word lid van het team van Interaction professionals bij Sogeti!

Als je wordt aangenomen, zal een PES-screening plaatsvinden als onderdeel van het onboardingproces bij Sogeti.

Wat kun je van ons verwachten:

  • Als je binnen het profiel van de vacature past of wij mogelijkheden binnen Sogeti zien, plannen we binnen drie werkdagen een kennismakingsgesprek met onze recruiters. Tijdens dit gesprek maken we kennis met jou en je achtergrond.
  • Na een positief eerste gesprek ontvang je een capaciteitentest en een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst. Deze geven ons inzicht in jouw capaciteiten en werkstijl.
  • Binnen vier werkdagen na het eerste gesprek en de tests volgt een verdiepend gesprek met een Career Manager en een vakinhoudelijke specialist. Hierbij beoordelen we je vakkennis en de persoonlijke klik.
  • Als wij positief zijn en jij ook enthousiast bent, ontvang je binnen twee werkdagen na het tweede gesprek ons aanbod.

Currently we are specifically looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch at a C1 level and reside in the Netherlands.

Heb je nog vragen over de vacature van Front-end Developer?

Jouw recruiter, Henk Wouda, beantwoordt ze graag. Bell, app of mail gerust.

tel: +31627576343

Recruiters Noordoost

Title: Junior AI Developer
Description:
Locatie: Den Bosch




🔥 Word pionier in een innovatieve AI-consultancy!




Heb jij een passie voor AI en technologie? Ben je recent afgestudeerd of heb je 0-2 jaar werkervaring? Dan is dit jouw kans om de eerste medewerker te worden van Waive Solutions - een ambitieuze AI-consultancy die bedrijven helpt het volledige potentieel van kunstmatige intelligentie te benutten!




💎 Waarom deze functie perfect is voor jou




Als Junior AI Developer krijg je een unieke kans die je nergens anders vindt: direct samenwerken met een ervaren AI-expert (12+ jaar ervaring) en meebouwen aan een groeiend bedrijf vanaf de grond. Geen koffie halen of standaardtaken uitvoeren - je duikt direct in het diepe en bouwt mee aan AI-oplossingen die écht impact maken.




👨‍💻 Wat je dag-tot-dag gaat doen




AI-oplossingen ontwikkelen voor echte klanten met real-world uitdagingen
Werken met OpenAI Pro, Claude, Langchain en Cursor om intelligente systemen te bouwen
Doorgroeien van junior naar projectleider in een snelgroeiend team
Meedenken over strategie en productontwerp als key speler in een klein team
Bijdragen aan een gave bedrijfscultuur waarin we samen succes bouwen




📈 Wat we je bieden




Persoonlijke mentoring door een ervaren AI-expert
Steep learning curve met hands-on brede project- en ondernemerservaring
Marktconform salaris tussen €2.800-€3.500 bruto p/m
Langetermijnperspectief voor wie zich bewijst binnen het bedrijf
Ruimte voor jouw eigen AI-ideeën binnen een stimulerende omgeving
Volledige uitrusting met laptop, telefoon en tools
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden incl. volledige uitrusting, reiskosten en pensioen
Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheid tot deels thuiswerken
Topwerksfeer met gezelligheid en ruimte voor sociale activiteiten




🏆 Wat maakt jou de ideale kandidaat




WO-achtergrond in Informatica, AI, Data Science of vergelijkbaar
Affiniteit met programmeren (Python/JavaScript is een pre)
Echte interesse in AI-toepassingen voor bedrijfsprocessen
Ondernemersmentaliteit - je denkt mee over alle bedrijfsaspecten
Sterk in communicatie met zowel technische als niet-technische mensen
Proactieve houding - je ziet kansen en grijpt ze




🎬 Sollicitatieproces




1. Kort telefonisch kennismakingsgesprek (15-20 min)

2. Face-to-face gesprek op kantoor in Den Bosch

3. Praktische opdracht om je probleemoplossend vermogen te testen

4. Laatste gesprek en eventueel aanbod




Enthousiast geworden?




Neem direct contact op met Sophron Vermeij via sophron@waiveconsulting.nl of via LinkedIn. We nodigen je graag uit voor een kop koffie op ons kantoor in centrum Den Bosch!




Word jij de eerste schakel in wat uitgroeit tot een toonaangevend AI-consultancybedrijf?




Let op: Onze nieuwe website is binnenkort live. De huidige website is nog verouderd.




Je moet in Nederland wonen en Nederlands spreken voor deze rol!

Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Job Title: Python Developer

Location: Amsterdam, NL

B2B Contract




Role Description:

Making sure that the team knows which standards to adhere to and guard this during development
Understand the agile startup methodology and comfortable to work this way
Optimize the use of Python frameworks
Ensure sufficient up to date documentation
Be able to contribute to software architecture and technical designs
Enable and implement continuous delivery (Jenkins/ArgoCD/Azure DevOps/GitHub Actions)
Prevent technical debt




Essential Skills:

Must have experience with the cycle of building and releasing software solutions from development all the way to production in a DevOps way of working.
This person knows about industry standards, architecture, clean code and is skilled with supporting team members to realize the desired results.




Desirable Skills:

Solid communication and collaboration skills in English
Fluency in Dutch is a plus
Experience with the Azure Data Stack (and/or Databricks or similar)

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. Data Scientist – VML

At VML, we help companies grow by accelerating their digital performance. As a Data Scientist, you’ll turn data into actionable insights that drive business growth. You'll work with large datasets, support decision-making, and help optimize digital marketing performance. With data at the core of our business, you’ll have the opportunity to work on impactful projects across industries.

What you’ll do

Analyze and interpret complex datasets to uncover insights that improve digital performance.

Develop dashboards and reports that make performance data accessible and actionable.

Support the development of predictive models and data-driven solutions.

Work closely with digital strategists, performance marketers, and developers to embed data into business strategies.

Present findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Stay ahead of the latest trends in data science, analytics, and digital marketing.

What we’re looking for

1-3 years of experience in data analysis or data science, preferably in a commercial or consulting environment.

Strong SQL skills for data processing and analysis.

Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.

Familiarity with machine learning techniques and statistical analysis is a plus.

Python skills are a plus, but not required—we can teach you on the job.

Knowledge of marketing analytics, attribution modeling, or A/B testing is a plus.

A proactive mindset—you don’t just analyze data, you spot opportunities and drive impact.

A strong communicator who can translate data into clear business insights.

A degree in a relevant field such as Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or similar.

Be part of our growing Data Science & Analytics team

At VML, data is central to everything we do. Our Data Science & Analytics team is growing fast and plays a key role in many of our projects. You’ll be surrounded by like-minded data professionals who are passionate about using data to drive impact. This is a unique opportunity to develop your skills in digital analytics, consultancy, and data science, working on high-impact projects. We’re here to help you grow.

Why VML?

At VML, we’re a digital accelerator—we help companies grow by optimizing their digital domain. You’ll be part of a team of ambitious, skilled professionals who thrive on solving complex digital challenges. We work closely with our clients and each other, fostering innovation, experimentation, and continuous learning.

We offer:

Exciting projects with top-tier brands.

A fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where your ideas matter.

A collaborative culture with a team of experts to learn from.

The freedom and responsibility to make an impact.

Fun—we love what we do, and we do it together.

Ready to make an impact in the digital world? Join us at VML.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization—creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers—who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.
Show more

Title: AI Specialist New
Description:
AI Specialist

Join CM.com as an AI Specialist! Leverage your AI expertise to connect teams, inspire innovation, and transform businesses with cutting-edge solutions.

Details

Location Amsterdam

Salary 3850 - 4500

Level Medior

Team Engage

About Us

Are you the bridge between AI technology and practical applications? Do you want to be in the absolute forefront of AI Development? Do you want to connect customers, product developers, and internal teams through your expertise in AI? Then we're looking for you! Be part of it and step into a role where you’ll be empowered to connect and drive change at CM.com.

Our ambition is to be an AI First company, meaning we don’t just use technology; we live it. CM.com is the place for innovators who share our enthusiasm for AI—whether they're powering up our products or transforming our own operations.

If you're passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we'd love to have you join our mission to change the way businesses and people connect.

You may already know us from those seamless SMS or WhatsApp messages you receive, the tickets you effortlessly grab for that upcoming festival, pay for anything with our payment solutions, or even through chatting with the helpful AI chatbot for support. All our services are integrated into our unique business structure, which consists of four business units: Connect, Pay, Live & Engage.

Since 1999, our philosophy has remained the same: “Do what you like, do what you’re good at, and contribute”.

What you will do

As an AI Specialist at our company, you play a crucial role in the success of our AI solutions. You're the expert who guides customers in effectively using our AI products, contributes to product development, and inspires colleagues with the possibilities of AI.

You will be mainly involved in two of our products: Inspire and HALO.

Inspire is the personalization AI Engine of CM.com. The AI personalization engine is designed to elevate customer engagement and foster meaningful relationships. CM.com's AI personalization engine provides a comprehensive suite of modules, each crafted to enhance your interaction strategies and deliver personalized experiences that resonate with your audience. Examples of the modules are for instance personal recommendations or predictive (re-)activation campaigns for our clients.

Besides personalization with AI, another CM product you will be broadly involved in is Halo. An advanced Agentic AI Platform that fundamentally transforms tasks and business processes. In recent years, organizations have gained experience with AI assistants that primarily work on a query basis (GenAI). The Agentic AI Platform HALO takes this a step further by offering proactive support that enables organizations to be ready for the future.

This role involves collaborating with colleagues and effectively guiding our clients in integrating AI into their businesses, meaning not every day is spent in the office. In addition to working from our offices in Tilburg, Breda, and Amsterdam, you will routinely visit our clients.

You Will, Amongst Others


Advise and educate customers on the possibilities and limitations of our AI products
Contribute to product development by improving market fit
Inspire and educate internal teams about AI
Analyze problems and opportunities related to AI implementations
Optimize and implement AI solutions across diverse sectors


You connect with us, if you

Feel connected to our Shared Values


Drive & Lead: We encourage the entrepreneurial spirit and are self-managed to be able to quickly grasp opportunities.
Grow & Learn: We keep evolving our innovation capabilities and help you to get the best out of yourself, both professionally and personally.
Together & Care: We love working together. We stimulate collaboration with utmost respect for each other regardless of gender, age, background, or beliefs.
Speed & Change: We are an agile and dynamic organization, that keeps adapting and knows how to respond to opportunities or change.


Additionally, You Have


Demonstrable knowledge and experience in applying AI concepts in practical situations
Multiple years of experience working in a setting similar to ours. You are able to communicate effectively and professionally with diverse stakeholders, including product teams, internal colleagues, and clients
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and solve complex problems
Data & technical skills: experience with programming, technical understanding of infrastructure (how API calls work are known to you), query capabilities, and interpreting results through dashboarding
Data Science knowledge: understanding of Generative AI (GenAI), Agentic AI, and Consumer AI
Fluency in English and Dutch
No problem with working from our offices in Tilburg, Breda, and Amsterdam or visiting the clients


Believe you’d be a great fit for this role, even if you don’t tick every box? Reach out to our Recruitment team! We’d be happy to connect and see if we can make it work together.

Benefits of working at CM.com

Your journey starts with the 3-day Global Onboarding at our Breda HQ. It's your fast track to CM.com awesomeness. Dive deep into our culture, connect with fellow game-changers, and get ready to join informative sessions, practical workshops, and great fun.

As a Club Member, you'll unlock a world of incredible benefits:


Fuel your mind: Daily healthy lunches and snacks to keep you energized.
Effortless commutes: Shuttle mobility cards and company cars get you where you need to be.
Invest in your future: A solid pension plan.
Take your time off: 25 vacation days with the option to buy 10 more to provide peace of mind.
Own your success: Become a shareholder with our Employee Share Purchase Program.
Level up your skills: Udemy, CM Academy, and exclusive Meetups with thought leaders to ensure you're always learning and growing.
Life's a party: Weekly drinks, board game nights, karaoke throwdowns, yearly ski trip, and more! We have something for everyone.


Here, diversity is our superpower. We celebrate every member, regardless of age, background, or beliefs.
Show more

  • Drive & Lead: We encourage the entrepreneurial spirit and are self-managed to be able to quickly grasp opportunities.
  • Grow & Learn: We keep evolving our innovation capabilities and help you to get the best out of yourself, both professionally and personally.
  • Together & Care: We love working together. We stimulate collaboration with utmost respect for each other regardless of gender, age, background, or beliefs.
  • Speed & Change: We are an agile and dynamic organization, that keeps adapting and knows how to respond to opportunities or change.

Additionally, You Have

  • Demonstrable knowledge and experience in applying AI concepts in practical situations
  • Multiple years of experience working in a setting similar to ours. You are able to communicate effectively and professionally with diverse stakeholders, including product teams, internal colleagues, and clients
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and solve complex problems
  • Data & technical skills: experience with programming, technical understanding of infrastructure (how API calls work are known to you), query capabilities, and interpreting results through dashboarding
  • Data Science knowledge: understanding of Generative AI (GenAI), Agentic AI, and Consumer AI
  • Fluency in English and Dutch
  • No problem with working from our offices in Tilburg, Breda, and Amsterdam or visiting the clients

Believe you’d be a great fit for this role, even if you don’t tick every box? Reach out to our Recruitment team! We’d be happy to connect and see if we can make it work together.

Benefits of working at CM.com

Your journey starts with the 3-day Global Onboarding at our Breda HQ. It's your fast track to CM.com awesomeness. Dive deep into our culture, connect with fellow game-changers, and get ready to join informative sessions, practical workshops, and great fun.

As a Club Member, you'll unlock a world of incredible benefits:

  • Fuel your mind: Daily healthy lunches and snacks to keep you energized.
  • Effortless commutes: Shuttle mobility cards and company cars get you where you need to be.
  • Invest in your future: A solid pension plan.
  • Take your time off: 25 vacation days with the option to buy 10 more to provide peace of mind.
  • Own your success: Become a shareholder with our Employee Share Purchase Program.
  • Level up your skills: Udemy, CM Academy, and exclusive Meetups with thought leaders to ensure you're always learning and growing.
  • Life's a party: Weekly drinks, board game nights, karaoke throwdowns, yearly ski trip, and more! We have something for everyone.

Here, diversity is our superpower. We celebrate every member, regardless of age, background, or beliefs.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Do you recognize opportunities and translate them into data science solutions? Can you convince others of the value of your models? Then we are looking for you!

What is your role as a Data Scientist?

As a Data Scientist at Budget Thuis, you are the expert in modeling customer behaviors and assets such as wind and solar parks. You translate challenges and ideas from other departments into data-driven solutions. You combine the domain knowledge of your colleagues with your critical thinking, knowledge of statistical methods, and programming skills. The challenges at Budget Thuis range from playing a leading role in the energy transition to optimizing the Budget Thuis app and growing our customer base. Additionally, we are a rapidly growing company that continuously aims to challenge the market. Quickly adapting and supporting business decisions with solid data analyses is essential for this. With loads of (historical) data available (think of energy consumption, customer contacts, weather forecasts, and online click behavior), your task is to use the right model and deliver valuable insights that contribute to profitability, sustainability, and customer satisfaction. Depending on the situation, this can range from a simple regression to a neural network.

What are your responsibilities?

In your role, you have a lot of freedom and responsibility: you work together with other data scientists but also need to be able to independently set up new analyses and models. Within the Data Science team, we divide the following responsibilities based on experience and knowledge:

  • Challenging the information needs of colleagues in sales, trading and finance;
  • Answering complex questions and challenges within the company with understandable analyses;
  • Analyzing and improving churn and recommendation models that are already in production;
  • Developing new models to stay up-to-date with market developments and improve internal processes. Think of the energy transition, sustainability, or electrification;
  • Maintaining our Big Data AWS environment and models in production;
  • Professionalizing, automating, and documenting key processes.

Who will you be working with?

The BI & Data Analytics department currently consists of 14 data specialists. Three colleagues focus on the data engineering side and provide the team with the necessary data through their ETL pipelines. Other colleagues provide insights to the entire company through reports and ad-hoc analyses. The rest of the team is mainly focused on Data Science challenges. Together, we build our data foundation, develop complex models, and conduct valuable analyses.

What do you bring?

  • A completed Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Econometrics, Computer Science, or Statistics);
  • At least 3 years of work experience in a similar role;
  • Proven experience applying Machine Learning techniques;
  • Strong command of Python (or a similar programming language, e.g., Java, Matlab, Julia);
  • Experience with cloud environments is a plus (e.g., PySpark, Hadoop, AWS, Azure);
  • Creativity to proactively translate data insights into improvement opportunities;
  • Strong analytical thinking and the ability to work independently, goal-oriented, and structured;
  • Good command of English, and preferably also Dutch.

At Budget Thuis, we find it important that you can be 100% yourself. Our organization is open to different perspectives and personalities, where we are curious and value each other. For this role, we are particularly looking for someone who enriches our team in every way. Someone who, through their background and personal characteristics, will be a valuable addition to Budget Thuis.

We offer you

  • A gross salary between €4.570 and €6.090 depending on knowledge and experience (based on 40 hours);
  • 13th month; The Budget Summer Free months in July and August where we have paid time off every Friday;
  • 25 vacation days (based on 40 hours) and the option to buy an additional 1.5 weeks;
  • One working day a year, colleagues can contribute to society as a volunteer;
  • A great pension plan: we provide 11% and you contribute 5%;
  • Sustainable travel allowance: Swapfiets or an NS Business Card;
  • Focus on vitality: weekly free boot camps and participation in events such as the Dam to Damloop, Mudmasters, and company soccer;
  • Nice extras for your anniversary (1, 3, and 5 years in service), including a dinner, a weekend away to Berlin or Paris, or the possibility to take a sabbatical;
  • Monthly, you receive ClassPass credits for various fitness and wellness activities;
  • Hybrid working: mix office life with remote working (50/50) and for enthusiasts, one month per year of 100% remote working;
  • Our chef prepares a delicious (hot) lunch daily for just €2 net per day;
  • A scale-up mentality where we value boldness and entrepreneurship. This makes Budget Thuis the challenger in the market, always doing things just a step better, faster, and smarter than competitors;
  • An office with cozy drinks and company parties in the heart of Amsterdam;
  • And as the icing on the cake, free use of internet and Budget mobile and a great deal on Budget energy.

A Certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required for this position. This will be requested after a successful selection process, and the costs can be reimbursed after successfully completing the probation period at Budget Thuis. For more information on the VOG, you can visit www.rijksoverheid.nl.

Questions & Contact Person

If you have any questions about this vacancy, please email Wouter van Ittersum at wouter.vanittersum@budgetthuis.nl

Recruitment inquiries based on this advertisement are not appreciated.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
About The Job

Do you love working with data and contributing to technological innovation? Are you a motivated and enthusiastic student with a passion for data science, food sciences, or chemical engineering? Then apply now and join us as our new Data Science Intern in our Utrecht office starting June 2025!

About The Job

As our new Data Science Intern, you will be part of our enthusiastic and diverse Data and Modelling team who help with technological innovation using data-driven decision-making within Danone’s One Planet One Health vision. Your key role will be to contribute to our model portfolio for filtration and hydrolysate processes. During this internship, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and support various initiatives. Your main responsibilities include


Collect and organize data from various sources (pdf, csv) to create a structured database.
Conduct root cause analysis to identify factors contributing to filter fouling.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover insights and trends.
Engage in feature engineering, modelling, validation, and report writing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and validate models.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Summarize results in a comprehensive report.


About you

As a Data Science Intern, data analysis and modelling will be second nature to you. You can collect and organize data, conduct root cause analysis, and perform exploratory data analysis. On top of that? You’re a proactive and creative individual who’s always looking for opportunities to learn and develop.

There are also some compulsory requirements


You are enrolled at a Dutch university for the whole duration of the internship (if you are a non-EU citizen, you must be enrolled in a Dutch university to be eligible for this internship).
You are fluent in English—both verbal and written.
You have knowledge of batch processes, filtration, and hydrolysis.
You are proficient in SQL and Python.
You are available to start from June 2025 for a minimum of 6 months, 5 days a week.
You are willing to travel to Utrecht, The Netherlands.


About us

Working at Danone is a unique experience. It’s fast-paced and complex and, at times, it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities to learn and grow working with some of the best-known brands in the world, like Evian, Alpro, Nutricia, Activia, and Nutrilon. Bring your unique perspective, ambitions, and entrepreneurial ideas to the table – the impact you could make might just surprise you. One Planet. One Health – BY YOU.

We’re proud to be a B-Corp certified company. That means we meet the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability in everything we do. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we base our hiring decisions on merit, job requirements, and business needs.

We Offer

As a Modelling Intern, you will learn extensively and have the opportunity to work alongside professionals in the field. And the best part? You’ll be supported from beginning to end by your supervisor and will have the chance to contribute to meaningful projects. Together, we’ll build a healthier world.

We offer a gross monthly internship allowance of 650 euros per month and a home working allowance/contribution towards travel. Please do keep in mind that we do not offer relocation and/or accommodation benefits for students coming from abroad.

In the Netherlands, we also offer a hybrid working environment which enables each team to meet our people's desire for flexibility. Across our 3 office hubs in Hoofddorp, Rijswijk, and Utrecht, this helps us create better opportunities for connection & synergies across our entities, teams, functions, and categories.

What’s Next

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button. In order to comply with GDPR, we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Gen AI
Description:
Within the Data Office, we have a team responsible for building impactful AI solutions. With these AI solutions, we help Schade & Inkomen to digitize important processes. An example of this is the digitization of our Claims processes. Your main goal is to create data science solutions for operational teams such as Acceptance and Claims together with your colleagues. You will also have a lot of contact with the colleagues for whom you build the solutions. We make a lot of impact!

What are you going to do

You understand how to help your colleagues from the business translate their wishes into AI solutions, and you especially enjoy presenting your solutions to the business and helping them adopt AI. With your solution-oriented and proactive mindset, you design the best data science solution for business problems together with your team, and you realize this using our AI toolkit. We work agile with colleagues from the business on projects that often span multiple sprints.

Specifically, you bring AI solutions into production so that your solutions truly create value for our company of tomorrow. Researching and applying new technology plays an important role. You use state-of-the-art techniques such as AI as a service and LLMs, like Cognitive Services and OpenAI. Additionally, you actively contribute to innovation within NN. During our monthly innovation day, you and your colleagues explore which new techniques are applicable within our company.

If you enjoy diving into the latest AI trends to find solutions for business problems, then this job is for you.

What we offer you

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:


Salary between €4,414 and €6,306 depending on your knowledge and experience
13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
A modern pension administered by BeFrank
Plenty of training and learning opportunities
NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled
Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use


We work hybrid at NN. Together with your team, you decide where, how and when you work. The official location of this job is The Hague

Who you are

You are result-oriented and enjoy delivering code projects for the business, but you especially see value in the further adoption of our AI solutions. Your open attitude and strong communication skills greatly help with this. Additionally, you have:


a completed university education with a master’s degree in Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, or another STEM-related field,
experience in developing ML applications in Python, practical knowledge of the data science process, such as data collection, cleaning, model evaluation, and model implementation, preferably experience in developing APIs, a plus if you have experience with developing automated cloud solutions using (Azure) CI/CD tools, Git, SQL, Terraform.
a plus if you have experience in designing AI solutions or applications based on business requirements,
a plus if you have experience with Generative AI such as LLMs,
You have a good command of the Dutch language.


Who you will work with

The team you work with on a daily basis consists of a group of data scientists, two engineers who help the team put the work into production, and a program manager who frames our activities. Of course, you work with many colleagues from the business. Together with these colleagues, we work daily with great enthusiasm and dedication to optimize and innovate customer service, processes, and quality, in close collaboration with the operational teams.

Additionally, you are a member of the data science guild where approximately 40 data scientists meet. Here, you exchange knowledge and experiences with peers. We believe that every data scientist can learn something from peers and vice versa can teach something to others in the community. This way, you accelerate your career and deliver maximum value with our AI solutions.

Any questions?

If you have any questions about the job, you can reach out via phone or WhatsApp to Ties Herpers (Recruiter) via 0617336328 or via ties.herpers@nn-group.com.

This is a permanent position. A candidate will receive a contract from NN and we are not open to interim/freelance assignments and/or candidates or recruitment agencies. Thank you very much for your understanding.

We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken
27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag
13e maand en vakantiegeld
Hybride werken
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.

We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.

The role

As an AI Engineer at Zeno, you will work at the forefront of AI and large language model (LLM) applications, designing and implementing intelligent systems that redefine how legal professionals access and utilize knowledge. You’ll explore cutting-edge advancements, tackle deeply technical challenges, and help bring AI-driven solutions to life.

This is a high-impact role where your contributions will shape the next generation of AI-powered legal tools—enhancing search, automation, and decision-making for legal professionals worldwide.

What You’ll Be Working On


Architect and deploy AI-driven solutions that enhance search, knowledge retrieval, and workflow automation.
Stay ahead of the curve by experimenting with state-of-the-art LLM models, including agentic flows and reasoning frameworks.
Optimize performance, scalability, and security while maintaining high-quality, production-ready code.
Rapidly prototype and validate new ideas, working closely with users to refine and deploy impactful AI applications.
Work alongside the technical founders, experienced engineers and legal professionals to push AI’s limits in legal tech.


What We’re Looking For


You thrive on technical challenges and have a deep passion for AI, LLMs, and building intelligent applications.
Experience working with AI and software development, preferably with LLM applications (either in work experience or side projects)
You’re skilled in Python, Java, C++, or JavaScript and can work across tech stacks to bring AI systems to life.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.


What We Offer


A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.


Let’s shape the future of legal work together
Show more
