Title: Junior Data Scientist - Marketing Technology
Description:
Are you able to transform raw data into valuable insights, have a strong business understanding, and enjoy solving challenging problems? Then this is an excellent opportunity to join our Data Science Team at our Stockholm office!




About the role

As a Junior Data Scientist at NoA Connect, you will help develop our data science offering by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, identifying new business opportunities, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. These solutions could range from classic data science problems, to building AI solutions, to constructing data pipelines.

You will be exploring, planning, and building solutions for internal cross-functional teams and clients. We strongly believe in being part of the client’s team and daily operations to be able to make the biggest impact possible.




Your background

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience in AI/ML
Experience in Python programming and SQL
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow and PyTorch) and deep learning techniques




It’s a plus if you also have…

Experience working with and managing stakeholders in complex projects. Preferably as a consultant
Have at least one certificate for GCP or Azure at professional level
Experience of Marketing Mix Modeling, predictive CLV and audience segmentation
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills




About us

NoA Connect is a part of The North Alliance – one of Scandinavia’s largest agency networks in design, media, and marketing. At NoA we believe that we are stronger together than as standalone agencies and that collaboration is the way to growth.




At NoA Connect, we help companies grow their business and people by transforming sales and marketing capabilities. Noa Connect has three business areas - Advisory, Performance (Bluebird) and Data & Analytics. We believe that a workplace should be a space where everyone feels welcome, no matter their background or unique perspectives. Simply put, we want people to enjoy working with us.




Our recruitment process

No need for a personal letter or a CV-document. Just provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions - that's it. Looking forward hearing from you!

Show more
HTML:
Are you able to transform raw data into valuable insights, have a strong business understanding, and enjoy solving challenging problems? Then this is an excellent opportunity to join our Data Science Team at our Stockholm office!


About the role

As a Junior Data Scientist at NoA Connect, you will help develop our data science offering by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, identifying new business opportunities, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. These solutions could range from classic data science problems, to building AI solutions, to constructing data pipelines.

You will be exploring, planning, and building solutions for internal cross-functional teams and clients. We strongly believe in being part of the client’s team and daily operations to be able to make the biggest impact possible.


Your background

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience in AI/ML
  • Experience in Python programming and SQL
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow and PyTorch) and deep learning techniques


It’s a plus if you also have…

  • Experience working with and managing stakeholders in complex projects. Preferably as a consultant
  • Have at least one certificate for GCP or Azure at professional level
  • Experience of Marketing Mix Modeling, predictive CLV and audience segmentation
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills


About us

NoA Connect is a part of The North Alliance – one of Scandinavia’s largest agency networks in design, media, and marketing. At NoA we believe that we are stronger together than as standalone agencies and that collaboration is the way to growth.


At NoA Connect, we help companies grow their business and people by transforming sales and marketing capabilities. Noa Connect has three business areas - Advisory, Performance (Bluebird) and Data & Analytics. We believe that a workplace should be a space where everyone feels welcome, no matter their background or unique perspectives. Simply put, we want people to enjoy working with us.


Our recruitment process

No need for a personal letter or a CV-document. Just provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions - that's it. Looking forward hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Intern – Electricity Markets (Forecasting)
Description:
Montel, an independent and rapidly growing provider of energy information, specialising in news, data, and analytics. We are a trusted information source to all key stakeholders in the energy sector, we strive for integrity, accuracy and a human approach in all we do.

Montel plays a key role by equipping companies with essential decision-making tools tailored for the dynamic energy markets as they make the transition to greener energy. Our clientele encompasses a wide range of entities including large energy consumers, producers, regulators, traders, consultants, authorities, media, and more.

💡 What You’ll Do


Develop and improve models for forecasting short-term markets with major focus on Nordic balancing market and ancillary services markets.
Work with large datasets from market operators, weather services, and grid operators.
Apply machine learning, statistical modelling, and time series analysis techniques.
Collaborate with a team of data scientists, engineers, and energy market analysts.
Communicate insights through dashboards, reports, and presentations.
Help with developing our platforms for analysis.


📚 What We’re Looking For


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Strong Python skills.
Experience with time series forecasting techniques.
Familiarity with electricity markets, energy trading, or renewable energy forecasting is a plus.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Innovative, curious, and collaborative mindset.


🚀 Why Join Us?


Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing sector.
Work on real-world challenges that impact the energy transition.
Mentorship from industry experts.
There is potential for future employment in Montel for those that excel
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Leverage the power of machine learning to revolutionize sustainable shopping for millions of customers.




"We value your ideas and curiosity since they are key enablers to keep up with the ever-changing machine learning field." - Therese, Head of Machine Learning.




Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and who are ready to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.




Machine Learning at Sellpy

We look for you who want to be part of our journey to make sustainable shopping the first-hand choice by building great product recommendations, using computer vision to make the item handling process smoother and other user-friendly solutions. We want to provide the best customer experience and that’s why we need you on board.




This job will suit you if you’re excited to build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning models and build custom models to solve unique challenges together with a team of highly motivated engineers.




In short, you will

Build machine learning models with a major impact on our product
Simplify, build and improve our already existing models
Build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning development
Enjoy personal growth during our level-up days once a month
Keep up with ML development with the team on weekly deep dives
Make use of your skills in Tensorflow and Python




Requirements

B.S or M.S. degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong proficiency in Python
Experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch
Experience with AWS or similar cloud service providers
Written and spoken fluency in English




We’d be impressed if you have

Previous experience with recommender systems
Knowledge about how to build efficient data pipelines
Experience in setting up ML systems in production
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL




You’ll get to

Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges on a daily basis.
Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, and from home.
Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform
Spend time on personal development during monthly level-up days.
Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
Save up with a monthly pension plan.
Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.




Location

You are welcome to do all these things at our office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.




Form of employment: Full-time

Start: As agreed upon

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
På B3 Indes förvandlar vi data till värdefulla insikter som driver förändring och innovation. Vi skapar lösningar inom AI, Business Intelligence, Data Science och Automation för att maximera värdet av data och stärka företags konkurrenskraft. Vår styrka ligger i att kombinera passion för AI och data med en stark laganda, där vi stöttar varandra och löser utmaningar tillsammans.

Rollen som Data Scientist på B3

Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med några av Sveriges mest spännande kunder och projekt. Vad innebär det? Jo, att du får:


Gräva i data och hitta insikter som inte bara hjälper våra kunder – utan kanske till och med gör världen lite bättre.
Göra företag mer datadrivna och smartare genom att guida dem i rätt riktning.
Bygga och implementera avancerade lösningar – och faktiskt se dem göra skillnad!


Här handlar det inte bara om teknik – det handlar om att skapa verklig förändring. Vi gillar att tänka stort, experimentera och lösa kluriga problem tillsammans. Och det bästa? Du får ett team av grymma kollegor att bolla idéer med, lära dig av och ha kul ihop med!

Det är din passion för AI och data som gör skillnaden. Utöver det ser vi gärna:


Har du en universitetsutbildning inom matematik eller statistik? Toppen! Har du kanske skaffat motsvarande kunskaper genom arbetslivserfarenhet? Det funkar lika bra!
Minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – vi letar efter någon som har hunnit samla på sig en del erfarenhet inom området.
Flytande svenska och engelska – eftersom båda språken används dagligen i arbetet.
Tidigare konsultroller är ett plus! Har du jobbat som konsult tidigare? Då är det en extra merit, men inget krav.


Men framför allt...

Har du erfarenhet av Machine Learning och Python? Grymt – det är värdefullt! Men vi lägger också stor vikt vid din förmåga att se helheten, skapa användbara lösningar men framförallt att du är nyfiken. Om du dessutom har koll på A/B-testning, modellering eller visualisering, är det ett plus – men absolut inget krav.

Varför välja B3 Indes?

💡 Utveckling & karriär – Väx i en entreprenörsdriven miljö där din kompetens får ta plats.

🌿 Balans & välmående – Vi värnar om ditt välbefinnande med stöd för wellness och en flexibel vardag.

🚀 Energi & gemenskap – Här präglas kulturen av öppenhet, nyfikenhet och en passion för att skapa något större – tillsammans.

❤️ Vi bryr oss – på riktigt – Vi engagerar oss i samhällsfrågor och samarbetar med initiativ som Suicide Zero, My Dream Now och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad även utanför arbetslivet.

En arbetsplats som gör skillnad:

Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.

Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.

Om B3 Consulting Group

B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.

Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.

Är du redo att bli en del av ett företag där din passion för AI och data kan göra skillnad? Läs mer om oss och våra möjligheter här!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Har du flera års erfarenhet och teknisk kompetens inom Data Science-projekt? Vi söker dig som är en passionerad och erfaren Data Scientist, där du blir en del av vårt satsningsområde där målsättningen är att bli ledande. Våra kunder har ett stort behov av automatisering genom intelligent automation och dataanalys, och vi behöver din expertis! Vill du forma framtidens digitala samhälle och ständigt utvecklas? Då har vi utmaningen för dig!

Din roll på Atea

Våra kunder genomgår en digital förändringsresa där du som Data Scientist kommer att ha en nyckelroll. I rollen som Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med allt från externa faktorer, programmering, dataanalys, API:er, backend och leverans, till att leda projekt och säkerställa hög prestanda i skala.

Konsultrollen erbjuder ett varierande arbete, ett längre uppdrag eller flera parallella, på egen hand eller i team med andra kollegor. Du möter nya människor och kontexter och som konsult ansvarar du för att driva projekt framåt och i mål, samt upptäcka ytterligare behov där både du och andra på Atea kan bidra för att skapa värde för kunden.

Du kommer att vara en del av vårt affärsområde Information Management som omfattar strategi, arkitektur, information & data analytics (AI, BI, RPA och IoT), verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, it-styrning, projektledning samt informations- och cybersäkerhet.

Rollen som Data Scientist på Atea erbjuder:


Möjlighet att leda och driva spännande data science-projekt
En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din goda affärsförståelse och starka kommunikationsförmåga, både internt och externt, kommer till sin rätt
En plattform för att utveckla dina interpersonella färdigheter och optimera prestanda genom kod- och dataflödesoptimeringar



Ditt team

Christian Hedén, Konsultchef på Atea, kommer att vara din närmste chef i rollen. Du kommer ingå ett närmsta team på åtta drivna och ansvarstagande kollegor som jobbar tätt tillsammans och alltid ställer upp för varandra. Du kommer även jobba tätt med andra team inom området nationellt på Atea. Inom teamet är det högt i tak och prestigelöst och vi har en bred kunskap som består av både juniora och seniora personer.

Vem är du?

Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas hos oss. Du är drivande och resultatinriktad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad med lätt för att anpassa dig till nya förhållanden. Du är kommunikativ, skapar goda relationer och har ett affärsmässigt fokus där du förstår innebörden att leverera hög klass på service mot våra kunder. Med god erfarenhet är du självgående inom området och du strävar efter att utvecklas inom området.

För rollen som Data Scientist ser vi att du har med dig:


Flertalet års erfarenhet av liknande roll med hög kompetensnivå inom statistisk modellering
Djup förståelse för relationer mellan verkliga faktorer, modellparametrar och tolkningar av modellresultat
Stark affärsförståelse och förmåga att skala upp prestanda, både internt och externt
Mycket goda kunskaper i Python
Erfarenhet av Machine Learning
Obehindrad i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande



Har vi väckt ditt intresse?

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christian Hedén, Konsultchef, via christian.heden@atea.se. Har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Annie Davnert, Talent Acquisition Partner, via annie.davnert@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!

Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.

Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.



Följ oss i sociala medier



 


Show more
HTML:
Har du flera års erfarenhet och teknisk kompetens inom Data Science-projekt? Vi söker dig som är en passionerad och erfaren Data Scientist, där du blir en del av vårt satsningsområde där målsättningen är att bli ledande. Våra kunder har ett stort behov av automatisering genom intelligent automation och dataanalys, och vi behöver din expertis! Vill du forma framtidens digitala samhälle och ständigt utvecklas? Då har vi utmaningen för dig!

Din roll på Atea

Våra kunder genomgår en digital förändringsresa där du som Data Scientist kommer att ha en nyckelroll. I rollen som Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med allt från externa faktorer, programmering, dataanalys, API:er, backend och leverans, till att leda projekt och säkerställa hög prestanda i skala.

Konsultrollen erbjuder ett varierande arbete, ett längre uppdrag eller flera parallella, på egen hand eller i team med andra kollegor. Du möter nya människor och kontexter och som konsult ansvarar du för att driva projekt framåt och i mål, samt upptäcka ytterligare behov där både du och andra på Atea kan bidra för att skapa värde för kunden.

Du kommer att vara en del av vårt affärsområde Information Management som omfattar strategi, arkitektur, information & data analytics (AI, BI, RPA och IoT), verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, it-styrning, projektledning samt informations- och cybersäkerhet.

Rollen som Data Scientist på Atea erbjuder:

  • Möjlighet att leda och driva spännande data science-projekt
  • En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din goda affärsförståelse och starka kommunikationsförmåga, både internt och externt, kommer till sin rätt
  • En plattform för att utveckla dina interpersonella färdigheter och optimera prestanda genom kod- och dataflödesoptimeringar

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!

Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.

Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.

Title: AI Engineer - Early Career Position
Description:
About The Role

AI Engineer - Early Career Position

We are seeking a highly motivated and talented early-career AI Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will have the exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of both traditional machine learning and cutting-edge generative AI within the financial services industry. You will contribute to the development and implementation of AI solutions that address real-world challenges. This role requires a strong foundation in AI/ML principles, software engineering skills, and a collaborative mindset.

Responsibilities


Develop and implement machine learning models: Design, build, and train traditional machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) for tasks such as risk assessment, trade prediction, and operational efficiency.
Explore and apply generative AI techniques: Research, experiment with, and implement generative AI models (e.g., transformers, large language models) for applications like data augmentation, synthetic data generation, anomaly detection, and natural language processing in financial contexts.
Collaborate on AI solutions: Work closely with experienced AI engineers, data scientists, and software developers to integrate AI models into existing systems and build new AI-powered applications. Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery.
Contribute to software development: Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including design, coding, testing, and deployment, adhering to best practices and industry standards. Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility.
Analyze and interpret data: Analyze large datasets, identify patterns and trends, and derive insights to inform model development and business decisions.
Stay current with AI advancements: Continuously learn and keep abreast of the latest research and trends in both traditional machine learning and generative AI.
Communicate effectively: Clearly communicate technical concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Research and innovate: Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Technical Skills:
Strong understanding of fundamental AI/ML concepts (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, natural language processing).
Experience with Python and relevant AI/ML libraries (e.g., Keras, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with generative AI models and frameworks (e.g., transformers, GPT).
Proficiency in software engineering principles and practices.
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and databases.
Soft Skills:
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment.

What’s In It For You

We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:


Rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks.
Streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change.
Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities.
Innovative culture with a strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue that drives technological and product improvements.


If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.

About OSTTRA

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.

Learn more at www.osttra.com.

What’s In It For You?

Benefits

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include


Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf

20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.

Learn more at www.osttra.com.

What’s In It For You?

Benefits

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include

  • Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  • Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  • Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  • Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  • Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Job ID: 313290

Posted On: 2025-03-14

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Data scientist till MedMera Bank
Description:
Data scientist till MedMera Bank




Ansök senast: 11 april 2025

Placering: Solna




Vi söker en vass Data Scientist till Team Data & Analys - är du redo för en ny utmaning?




På MedMera Bank tycker vi att det är viktigt att fatta beslut baserade på data och analys, därför är vårt team inom Data Science centralt för beslut på alla nivåer i banken. Gruppen har kommit långt i sitt arbete med maskininlärning och avancerad analys.




Vi är ett litet företag med snart 60 anställda som är snabbfotade i såväl beslut som implementation. Hos oss får du snabbt ta ansvar och lösa riktiga problem. Vi hjälper gärna våra kollegor att lyckas och våra medarbetarundersökningar visar att vi trivs och har roligt tillsammans. Teamet du kommer tillhöra kallas Data & Analys och består av tre data scientists och två data engineers.




Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter

Vi ansvarar för data, analys, och modellering av kreditrisk, prissättning och lönsamhet. Vårt huvudfokus är att skapa en lönsammare bank men vi hjälper också våra kollegor på andra avdelningar med rapportbehov och automatisering av återkommande arbetsuppgifter.




Vårt jobb är bland annat att sätta rätt pris till rätt kund för vår privatlånprodukt. Detta gör vi genom egenutvecklade ML-modeller, analyser och många diskussioner om olika vägval. Vi jobbar i Google Cloud Platform (bl.a. VertexAI och BigQuery) och programmerar i Python och SQL. Vår utvecklingsmiljö är modern och effektiv – vi tar hjälp av rätt verktyg på rätt plats och AI-stöd i arbetet är en självklarhet för att frigöra tid till det som verkligen gör skillnad.




Hos oss på MedMera Bank kommer du att arbeta direkt mot bankens ledningsgrupp, bland annat mot vår VD och kreditchef. Detta innebär att du har stora möjligheter att påverka de beslut banken tar i viktiga frågor. Det ställer också krav på dig att inte bara räkna rätt utan också att kunna förklara vad du kommit fram till på ett pedagogiskt sätt.




Teamet du kommer arbeta i är välfungerande och utmärker sig genom att vi hjälps åt, har roligt och löser komplexa problem tillsammans. Vi är också bra på att styra upp sociala aktiviteter som AW, brädspelskväll eller liknande. Nya initiativ är varmt välkomna!




Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som står på en stabil grund inom matematik, maskininlärning och programmering. Utöver det har du också en vilja att lära dig det du behöver kunna för att ta ditt arbete hela vägen från analys till produktion. Du har en pragmatisk inställning till din kompetens och de tekniker du använder – det viktiga är hur de kan användas för att generera insikter och driva lönsamhet.




Som person är du ödmjuk, gillar att samarbeta med andra, trivs med högt tempo och varierande arbetsuppgifter. I den här tjänsten finns det en stor möjlighet att lära sig både bank och data science och du kommer få utmanande uppgifter från start. Vi tror att det är viktigt att du litar på din egen analytiska förmåga för att lyckas i tjänsten.




Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har;

Universitetsexamen inom kvantitativt område (till exempel civilingenjör, matematik, statistik eller data science).
Gedigna kunskaper i Python, eller annan programmeringserfarenhet som gör dig trygg oavsett miljö/språk.
Grundläggande kunskaper i SQL.
Egen drivkraft och förmåga att självständigt lära dig nya saker som du även kan applicera i arbetet för att lösa de problem du stöter på.
Goda kunskaper i svenska språket då vi dokumenterar och rapporterar mestadels på svenska.




Det är meriterande om du har;

Kunskap om GCP (eller annan molntjänst) och DevOps / MLOps.
Kunskap om bank och produkter som privatlån.
Kunskap om andra programmeringsspråk.
Erfarenhet från liknande arbetsuppgifter.
Ett dokumenterat intresse för programmering, exempelvis hobbyprojekt på Github.




Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Eftersom vi arbetar för en jämn könsfördelning ser vi gärna kvinnliga sökande till den här tjänsten. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef, Kristofer Björnström, e-post; kristofer.bjornstrom@medmerabank.se. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.




Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer!




Om företaget

MedMera Bank är ett helägt dotterbolag till KF. Sedan 2007 bedriver MedMera Bank bankverksamhet under Finansinspektionens tillsyn.




MedMera Banks uppdrag är att leverera medlemsnytta till kunderna och affärsnytta till Coop-butikerna och därigenom skapa lönsamhet som säkrar bankens framtid. MedMera Bank har idag ca 60 anställda.




Kontaktperson

Kristofer Björnström

kristofer.bjornstrom@medmerabank.se

Show more

Vi söker dig som står på en stabil grund inom matematik, maskininlärning och programmering. Utöver det har du också en vilja att lära dig det du behöver kunna för att ta ditt arbete hela vägen från analys till produktion. Du har en pragmatisk inställning till din kompetens och de tekniker du använder – det viktiga är hur de kan användas för att generera insikter och driva lönsamhet.


Som person är du ödmjuk, gillar att samarbeta med andra, trivs med högt tempo och varierande arbetsuppgifter. I den här tjänsten finns det en stor möjlighet att lära sig både bank och data science och du kommer få utmanande uppgifter från start. Vi tror att det är viktigt att du litar på din egen analytiska förmåga för att lyckas i tjänsten.


Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har;

  • Universitetsexamen inom kvantitativt område (till exempel civilingenjör, matematik, statistik eller data science).
  • Gedigna kunskaper i Python, eller annan programmeringserfarenhet som gör dig trygg oavsett miljö/språk.
  • Grundläggande kunskaper i SQL.
  • Egen drivkraft och förmåga att självständigt lära dig nya saker som du även kan applicera i arbetet för att lösa de problem du stöter på.
  • Goda kunskaper i svenska språket då vi dokumenterar och rapporterar mestadels på svenska.


Det är meriterande om du har;

  • Kunskap om GCP (eller annan molntjänst) och DevOps / MLOps.
  • Kunskap om bank och produkter som privatlån.
  • Kunskap om andra programmeringsspråk.
  • Erfarenhet från liknande arbetsuppgifter.
  • Ett dokumenterat intresse för programmering, exempelvis hobbyprojekt på Github.


Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Eftersom vi arbetar för en jämn könsfördelning ser vi gärna kvinnliga sökande till den här tjänsten. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef, Kristofer Björnström, e-post; kristofer.bjornstrom@medmerabank.se. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.


Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer!


Om företaget

MedMera Bank är ett helägt dotterbolag till KF. Sedan 2007 bedriver MedMera Bank bankverksamhet under Finansinspektionens tillsyn.


MedMera Banks uppdrag är att leverera medlemsnytta till kunderna och affärsnytta till Coop-butikerna och därigenom skapa lönsamhet som säkrar bankens framtid. MedMera Bank har idag ca 60 anställda.


Kontaktperson

Kristofer Björnström

kristofer.bjornstrom@medmerabank.se

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vi söker en driven och kunnig Data Scientist eller Machine Learning Engineer till vårt Recommendation Engine-team på ICA Sverige. I denna roll kommer du att analysera och tolka stora mängder data samt designa, bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller för att lösa affärsutmaningar. Du kommer att arbeta med att implementera och optimera data pipelines för att säkerställa effektiv drift och nyttjande av driftsatta modeller. Dessutom kommer du att visualisera och presentera insikter för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.

Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker dig som har relevant erfarenhet med en kombination av maskininlärning, data science och data engineering med stark matematisk kompetens. Du bör ha minst 3 års erfarenhet av dataanalys och att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller. Stark programmeringskunskap, helst i Python, och erfarenhet av att bearbeta data med SQL är ett krav. Erfarenhet av att arbeta på en Cloud-plattform, helst GCP, är meriterande.

Därför ska du välja ICA

Hos ICA får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där du kan utvecklas och växa. Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att spegla våra kunder och samhället. Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsplats och möjligheten att arbeta med spännande projekt som gör skillnad. I denna roll kommer du att samarbeta nära med kollegor inom Customer Solutions, Försäljning och Marknad för att skapa värdefulla lösningar för våra kunder.

Vad händer nu?

Ansök så snart som möjligt men senast 1 april, vi gör löpande urval. För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Markus Koppari på 072-2202831.

Om ICA

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Choreograph, part of GroupM, we’re leading the way in data-driven marketing solutions. We collaborate with the world’s most ambitious brands to solve complex challenges in media and marketing through data and technology. From econometrics and media buying algorithms to dashboards and strategic consulting, our work has an impact.

At Choreograph, data science plays a key role in how we support some of the world’s largest brands in making informed decisions. By leveraging advanced analytics and innovative methodologies, we empower businesses to optimize their marketing strategies and uncover insights that drive real results.

If you’re passionate about using data to solve challenging problems and want to work with brands such as Samsung, Tele2, Coca-Cola, TUI and L’oreal in a collaborative environment, this could be the perfect role for you!

What You’ll Do

We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team in Stockholm. In this role, you will:


Take the lead in helping our clients understand and measure the true impact of their marketing investment using measurement methods such as Marketing mix modelling.
You will collaborate closely with colleagues to transform technical output such as outputs from a model built using Python into clear, actionable insights. Your work will involve packaging and presenting these findings in an engaging and accessible way to inform and inspire C-level stakeholders at some of the largest companies in the Nordics.
You will contribute to exciting and impactful projects, and be able to work on projects involving attribution modeling, experiments, and algorithm development, while also contributing to the development of automated reporting tools and other innovative data science initiatives.


Qualifications

Requirements-Please note that this is an entry-level position (0–2 years of experience), so the competence level of below requirements should align with skills gained through education or limited work experience.


Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar.
A curious and business-oriented mindset, with a willingness to learn about (or prior knowledge of) the marketing industry.
Strong storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical audiences.
Experience from programming (we use Python as our main coding language)
Experience applying analytical methods such as time series analysis, statistics, media mix modeling, or econometrics.
You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
You have a valid permit in Sweden.
You have excellent skills in Excel and Powerpoint.


Nice to have


Practical experience in a data science, analytics consultant, or similar role.
Hands-on experience with Marketing Mix Modelling.
Previous experience of Bayesian statistics.
Experience with Cloud platforms, SQL, GIT, Power BI, or other relevant technologies.


Additional Benefits At Choreograph


The opportunity to work with leading global and local brands in a dynamic, innovative industry.
A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive team culture.
Access to personal and professional development opportunities within GroupM and WPP, with clear pathways for growth.
A centrally located office in Stockholm, with flexible hybrid work options to support work-life balance.
Benefits, including wellness allowances, pension plans, and occupational healthcare, to support your well-being.


Application 

    

The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.     

In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.     

Contact 

  

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Lisa Gröning (lisa.groning@choreograph.com) or Viktor Åhlén (viktor.ahlen@choreograph.com). We do not accept applications via e-mail. 

About GroupM

     

GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Choreograph. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?




Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.




Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.




Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.




Who You Are

We expect you to have:

Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.







Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.




About the Data domain

The Data domain is part of the Product and Tech function with the mission of transforming Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.

About the role

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our Machine Learning team. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work on building and deploying machine learning models that will help drive and automate critical business decisions within our product services. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ML applications, collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, and take ownership of end-to-end machine learning lifecycles. If you're passionate about ML and AI, problem-solving, and building scalable solutions, we’d love to have you on board.




What you’ll do
Model Development & Optimization: Develop end-to-end pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production environments and continuously improve model performance through feature selection, hyperparameter tuning and model lifecycle management
Data Pipeline Design & Management: Build and maintain efficient data pipelines for data collection, preprocessing, and feature transformation to ensure high-quality near real-time input for ML models
Performance Monitoring: Monitor and evaluate feature drift and the performance of deployed models, ensuring they meet business requirements and adjusting as necessary to maintain a high level of model performance over time
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects and product managers to understand the business needs and translate them into scalable machine learning products
Stay Ahead of Trends: Keep up with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies, applying new methodologies and tools to enhance the effectiveness of your work





Who you are
Experience: You have 5+ years of hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment with near real-time latency
Education: You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

Technical Skills:
Proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, or C++
Experience with ML frameworks such as Sagemaker, MLFlow, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch and similar frameworks
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistics, and optimization techniques
Experience working with ML Operations, model lifecycle, infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines for model deployment
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, and deploying ML models at scale in said platforms
Experience with big data tools and distributed computing (e.g., Spark, Apache Beam/Flink)
Experience working with streaming data pipelines in Kafka (or similar)
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker)
Experience within open banking is a plus but not required








Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.

If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and kindly submit your CV in English.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

HTML:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
  • Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
  • Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
  • Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
  • Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends


Qualifications:

  • Experience as a Data Scientist
  • Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
  • Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden


What would make you really stand-out:

  • Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
  • Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
  • Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.


What We Offer:

  • An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
  • A challenging role in a fast-growing market
  • Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
  • 40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
  • Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
  • A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
  • Competitive salary and great benefits
  • Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
  • Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
  • Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
  • Collective agreements
  • 30 days holiday entitlement

Title: Data Scientist II - Core Experience
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join The Band and help drive a data-first culture across Spotify, specifically within the organization behind our mobile app experience - CoreX. Our Data Scientist mission is to turn terabytes of data into insights and get a deep understanding of music and listeners so that we can impact the strategy and direction of Spotify. Within CoreX, we use data to create the best mobile experience possible. You will study user behavior, critical initiatives, markets, content, and new features and bring data and insights into every decision we make.

What You'll Do


Perform analyses on large sets of data to extract practical insights on the user experience that will help drive decisions across the business, with a special focus on the mobile experience.
Coordinate and execute A/B experiments across the mobile apps, effectively driving robust decision-making and understanding the impact of our work on users.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and recurring reporting results, empowering creative growth and business decision making.
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key collaborators across all levels of seniority.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, product owners, engineers, designers, and others across the company who are passionate about Spotify’s success.
Be a member of the Spotify-wide data-science community.


Who You Are


You have a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or another similar quantitative subject area.
You have 2+ years of experience in a similar role as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst OR 5+ years of experience in product development with a keen interest in data.
Strong interpersonal skills and comfort working with stakeholders across disciplines (technical and non-technical) and across seniority levels.
Experience using various analysis techniques, such as linear and logistic regression, significance testing, and statistical modeling.
Practical experience with A/B testing methodologies.
Proficiency with Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Proficiency in SQL (We use Google BigQuery).
Experience performing analyses with large datasets and generating relevant answers and impactful insights.
Experience with data visualization tooling (Data Studio, Tableau, etc).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in London or Stockholm
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Show more

Title: AI Developer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a team that is developing tomorrow's businesses and

organizations? At PwC Sweden, we share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust and transparency, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Together, we create a meaningful and rewarding career for you.

Become a part of PwC’s Internal Firm Services

As an employee within PwC's business support, you play an important role in ensuring that the organization operates smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our clients and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that collaborate to support internal operations. We work with everything from communications, marketing, human resources, and IT to finance, procurement, risk management, and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating within these various departments, the organization can leverage our specialized knowledge to support and improve operations on a larger scale.

Are you our new colleague in the fast growing AI team?

Are you passionate about AI and eager to make a tangible impact? We are looking for a developer who excels in collaboration and enjoys building strong relationships with colleagues to ideate and develop exciting AI solutions. You are naturally curious and adaptable, finding joy in solving complex problems. You take pride in your personal responsibility and are driven to achieve outstanding results.

We offer opportunities for your continuous professional growth, supported by the

collaborative environment within the work environment you're part of. A strong

inclination to collaboration is essential, as you will often work in diverse environments and support different business units.

Your Main Tasks Would Include


Lead the deployment and continuous maintenance of machine learning models


and AI solutions, ensuring high performance and effectiveness in solving

business challenges.


Assist in the design and development of machine learning models and AI


solutions to address business problems.


Assist in the development and maintenance of product pipelines.
Stay current with the latest advancements and industry trends in AI, and apply


them to improve existing processes.


Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance skills and knowledge,


fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

Qualifications For The Position


Relevant education, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science,


Mathematics, Electronics or a related field.


Proficiency in Python.
Practical understanding of generative AI frameworks (vector databases,


LangChain frameworks, OpenAI frameworks,etc).


Experience working with technical requirements, development, testing, etc.
Experience implementing machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g.,


scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).


Excellent communication, presentation and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively and adapt to diverse and dynamic environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in both spoken and written English.
Collaborate with the global PwC network to identify opportunities for AI


innovations and drive the implementation of new technologies and

methodologies to PwC Sweden.

,

Recruitment Process

We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.

Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application


CV
Cover letter


We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.

We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.

Do you have questions? Let us know!

Questions relating to the job will be answered by Nithin Virinchipuram,

nithin.virinchipuram@pwc.com

If you instead have questions about the recruitment process or your application, reach out to the recruiter: Alexandra Lindskoog, alexandra.lindskoog@pwc.com
Show more

Title: Summer Intern (Machine Learning)
Description:
Summer Internship: AI-Powered Pricing for Cohort Financing

Location: Remote / Flexible

Duration: Summer 2025

This internship focuses on developing an AI-powered pricing tool that optimizes financing terms based on customer cohort data. The tool will provide the optimal financing amount (X) and interest rate (p) to maximize profitability while maintaining a specified risk range.

Project Details


Risk Modeling: Build a machine learning model to predict financing risk using customer Lifetime Value (LTV) and churn volatility.
Profitability Optimization: Develop an optimization framework to determine the best financing amount (X) and interest rate (p).
Pricing Tool Development: Integrate risk and profitability models into a functional prototype with user-adjustable risk parameters.
Documentation & Evaluation: Deliver a well-documented prototype demonstrating the tool’s functionality.


Scope


Focus on modeling and prototyping, not full implementation.
Provide clear analysis and evaluation of the pricing tool.


Who Should Apply?


Students in Computer Science, Data Science, Finance, or related fields.
Experience with Python, ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Understanding of optimization, risk modeling, and financial concepts is a plus.


What is Gilion?

At Gilion, we’re building the world’s largest Growth Platform for founders. Our technology is at the heart of everything we do, enabling entrepreneurs to achieve their goals faster through innovative funding and analytics solutions. Our platform seamlessly connects raw business data to cutting-edge growth models, offering founders unparalleled insights and access to growth loans that are unmatched in the market.

We're a group of engineers hailing from leading innovators like Google, Spotify, King, Anyfin, and Einride. We've joined forces with some of the brightest minds in banking to assist entrepreneurs in growing their businesses smarter and faster. Traditionally, founders have been left to navigate the fundraising journey alone.

The Gilion platform offers immediate access to a powerful analytics tech stack, featuring intuitive visualizations and advanced forecasting without needing SQL or CSS. Our data-driven approach helps founders understand their performance compared to peers, as the industry shifts towards more objective, data-backed investment decisions. We’re fully committed to driving a new era for how entrepreneurs grow their ventures on a global scale.

Title: Fraud Analyst/Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about data-driven fraud prevention? We are looking for a Fraud Analyst/Data Scientist to join our fraud team. In this role, you will work with ML/AI models, advanced analytics, and real-time data to detect and prevent fraud.

You will analyze large datasets, develop predictive models, and create dashboards to track fraud patterns and trends. Working closely with Credit Underwriting, IT, and Data Engineering teams, you will help enhance fraud detection capabilities and optimize decision-making processes. Your work will play a key role in shaping data-driven fraud prevention strategies.

If you enjoy working with data, automation, and predictive analytics to solve real-world challenges, this is an exciting opportunity to make an impact in a fast-moving environment.

Who You Are


5+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and statistical modeling.
Experience with SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools (SAS, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to translate data into insights and drive business decisions.
Experience in financial fraud prevention and/or fraud risk management is a plus.



Resurs in brief

At Resurs, we make everyday finances easier through innovative and customer-focused solutions. With customers across the Nordics and a team of around 700 colleagues, we are committed to delivering long-term value for individuals, businesses, and society. Being named a career company for the past six years, we have a strong focus on emphasizing both personal and professional growth. With an inclusive and diverse culture, we create a workplace where employees are valued, supported, and encouraged to reach their full potential.

Join an international team

Although we are based in the Nordics, our team is enriched by the breadth of perspectives brought by colleagues from countries such as South Africa, Australia, Iran, Germany, New Zealand, the US, and India. We foster a welcoming and supportive culture, where collaboration drives us to achieve the best outcomes for our users.

Apply today!

Don’t wait to send in your application. Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the last application date.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Important information

On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company.


In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.



Resurs has more than 40 years of experience in retail finance and is one of the leading niche banks in the Nordics. We help companies and private individuals with lending, savings and payments. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 650 employees in the Nordic region.

Follow us on Instagram:

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data team and drive the Data & Analytics strategy for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open-world game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios!

This role will be responsible for owning and developing analytics strategies and collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams. It requires experience from live product environments, strong leadership skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with our publishing partner, Microsoft. This is a key role that combines technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership to ensure that Contraband delivers exceptional player experiences and meets its business goals.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement robust analytics strategies tailored to a live premium AAA game.
Collaborate with Data, Product, Creative, and Tech teams to align analytics efforts with broader project goals.
Design and implement advanced data models, pipelines, A/B tests and dashboards to monitor game performance and player behavior.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable insights that guide game and business decisions.
Ensure seamless communication and collaboration with Microsoft’s Business, Product, Data, and Tech teams to drive analytics success.
Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices, mentoring the team, and providing training across the organization.
Design efficient and scalable analytics processes, conducting regular code and methodology reviews.


Who You Are


Proven experience (5+ years) as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in gaming or digital entertainment.
Proven experience leading analytics strategies for live games or similar live product environments, ideally in the premium AA or AAA gaming space.
Expertise in visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R.
Advanced SQL Skills: Writing complex, optimized SQL queries and understanding query performance tuning.
Experience collaborating across disciplines (Product, Creative, Tech) and with publishers.
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to diverse audiences along with the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A passion for gaming!


Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.

The Stockholm location

Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.

Our values

At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.

How To Apply

To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.
Show more
