Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se
Show more

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:

  • Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
  • Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
  • Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
  • Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
  • Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
  • Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
  • Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:

  • Generös kompetensutveckling
  • Attraktiv lönemodell
  • En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning

Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Petra, för denna tjänst på petra.magnusson@b3.se

Title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI Applied Engineer
Description:
About Lovable...




We’re Lovable: a small, ambitious crew of serial founders, physicists, competitive programmers, and product engineers.

Our goal? Be the first to make autonomous code generation work.

We’re pioneering a new way for anyone to create and maintain web apps using plain English. Combining LLMs + novel UX + clever algorithms, we’re building a bridge between coders and non-coders.




The role: AI Applied Engineer




You’ll be at the cutting edge of autonomous coding, ensuring that our product is robust, reliable, and continually pushing the frontier of what’s possible.

Your mission is to identify the biggest challenges impacting reliability—and come up with inventive, creative solutions. This isn’t just about making things work; it’s about making them unfailingly excellent and scalable.




What you’ll do:




Push the Limits: Identify bottlenecks and failure points in our code generation pipeline and devise ingenious ways to overcome them.
Innovate & Iterate: Experiment with state-of-the-art reliability techniques for LLMs and autonomous agents.
Rapid Debugging: Pinpoint and resolve complex reliability issues with speed and precision.
Data-Driven Improvements: Analyze reliability patterns, run failure analyses, and implement strategies to boost accuracy and performance.
Dogfood to the Max: Rigorously use our own product for internal development, pushing it to the limit in real-world scenarios, surface edge cases, break things (on purpose), and refine the product from the inside out.




What we’re looking for:




Full-Stack Proficiency: Experience working with full-stack applications, preferably using React on the frontend.
Experience with LLMs: Practical experience working with LLMs and their quirks.
Inventive Problem-Solving: You see challenges as puzzles waiting to be cracked, and you bring unconventional ideas to the table.
Fast Debugger: You can quickly identify, analyze, and fix complex AI Applied issues.
Bias for Action: You move fast, experiment, and iterate; shipping solutions is in your DNA.
Curiosity for the Cutting Edge: You stay up-to-date with the latest research and apply it pragmatically.
Strong Communication: Ability to clearly explain reliability challenges, solutions, and trade-offs to both technical and non-technical teammates.




Why Lovable?




Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis




If you’re ready to help build the last piece of software—we want to hear from you. Let’s make something Lovable.




About your application:




Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system.
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you. Hit apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.
Show more

We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?




Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.




Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.




Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.




Who You Are

We expect you to have:

Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.







Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team, build centralised data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralised ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organisation.

As a Senior ML Engineer, you will be working hands-on to optimise training and deployment of ML models to be quick and cost-efficient. You will also be at the forefront of putting our ML models on mobile devices to enhance data privacy and customer experience. To achieve this you will need to collaborate with teams across Truecaller to establish best practices and tools for efficient ML model development and deployment, particularly on mobile platforms. You will be expected to help Truecaller reach and stay at the cutting edge of ML training and deployment, as well as explore new frontiers such as federated learning.

The impact you will create:


Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organisation, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
Work with teams throughout Truecaller, enabling them to put models into production quickly and cost-effectively.
Work hands-on with teams throughout Truecaller to optimise ML models for mobile devices.
Be the go-to expert for developing models for mobile devices as well as deploying them.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in ML Engineering, especially ML on mobile phones, and driving continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.


What you bring in:


5+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on deploying ML models in production environments.
A strong understanding and experience how to optimise feature engineering, model training, and model deployment.
Hands-on experience deploying ML models on mobile devices (e.g., TensorFlow Lite, Core ML, ONNX Runtime Mobile).
Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX) and their deployment on mobile platforms.
Understanding of both Android and iOS development and how that impacts ML model deployment and usage.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
A customer-focused mindset.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.


It would be great if you also have:


Hands-on experience developing ML models.


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data team and drive the Data & Analytics strategy for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open-world game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios!

This role will be responsible for owning and developing analytics strategies and collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams. It requires experience from live product environments, strong leadership skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with our publishing partner, Microsoft. This is a key role that combines technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership to ensure that Contraband delivers exceptional player experiences and meets its business goals.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement robust analytics strategies tailored to a live premium AAA game.
Collaborate with Data, Product, Creative, and Tech teams to align analytics efforts with broader project goals.
Design and implement advanced data models, pipelines, A/B tests and dashboards to monitor game performance and player behavior.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable insights that guide game and business decisions.
Ensure seamless communication and collaboration with Microsoft’s Business, Product, Data, and Tech teams to drive analytics success.
Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices, mentoring the team, and providing training across the organization.
Design efficient and scalable analytics processes, conducting regular code and methodology reviews.


Who You Are


Proven experience (5+ years) as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in gaming or digital entertainment.
Proven experience leading analytics strategies for live games or similar live product environments, ideally in the premium AA or AAA gaming space.
Expertise in visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R.
Advanced SQL Skills: Writing complex, optimized SQL queries and understanding query performance tuning.
Experience collaborating across disciplines (Product, Creative, Tech) and with publishers.
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to diverse audiences along with the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A passion for gaming!


Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.

The Stockholm location

Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.

Our values

At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.

How To Apply

To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Data & Analys till SJ
Description:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ.

Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad - både för SJ och våra kunder.

SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.

Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.

Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:


Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion


Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.

Förväntningar på den vi söker


En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll
Show more

  • Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data

  • Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
  • En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
  • Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
  • Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
  • Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer for a Fast-Growing Startup 🚀




Are you a skilled backend developer looking to make a real impact in an ambitious and fast-paced environment?

As part of their team you'll have the opportunity to help shape a product that genuinely improves people’s everyday lives. 🙌




What You’ll Do

🚀 Enhance and expand their platform.
🤝 Collaborate closely with other developers and key stakeholders to identify and address customer needs.
🛠️ Take ownership of projects, driving both development and improvements.




What They're Looking For

🧠 2–3 years of experience in web development, with strong Python skills.
🔍 An analytical mindset and passion for clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
🌐 A solid understanding of digital transformation and industry modernization.
A bonus: Django development, Open API's and integrations, AWS (or other cloud environments)




Why Join Them?

🎉 Be part of an enthusiastic, collaborative team where your contributions matter.
💡 Join a company culture that values creativity, learning, and mutual support.
🏢 Work from a central location with flexibility to suit your lifestyle.
📈 Access career development opportunities in a rapidly scaling startup.







If you’re excited about being a key player in building something transformative and contributing to a growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ Send us your CV and portfolio today!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
The Team:

The development team is based in Stockholm. It consists of highly skilled and helpful individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing a unique part in serving our global customer base. We value learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.




The Impact:

OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade processing. Our products within the Trade Lifecycle division cover many of these areas, such as portfolio reconciliation, risk calculations, collateral management, and settlement automation. Improving these systems has a real impact on reducing the systemic risk of the global financial market while boosting operational efficiency and producing cost savings for many of the largest banks in the world.




What’s in it for you:

Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including e.g. Python, Elm, Kubernetes, relational and NoSQL databases)
Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)




Responsibilities:

Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
Uphold architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
Mentor colleagues
Understanding customer requirements/needs




What We’re Looking For:

3-10 years of relevant experience
An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you, and our ways of working
Good communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week




We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:

A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
An interest in financial markets







About OSTTRA




Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.




OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.




Learn more at www.osttra.com.




What’s In It For You?




Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.




Our benefits include:

Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries




-----------------------------------------------------------




Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

  • Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)

  • Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
  • Uphold architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
  • Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
  • Mentor colleagues
  • Understanding customer requirements/needs


What We’re Looking For:

  • 3-10 years of relevant experience
  • An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you, and our ways of working
  • Good communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
  • Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week


We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:

  • A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
  • An interest in financial markets



About OSTTRA


Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.


OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.


Learn more at www.osttra.com.


What’s In It For You?


Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.


Our benefits include:

  • Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  • Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  • Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  • Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  • Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  • Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries


-----------------------------------------------------------


Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

Title: AI Training Expert - Part Time Work From Home
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Swedish for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Swedish (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Senior Python / Django Developer - Stockholm Office (2 Days Per Month) - 55,000 SEK - 75,000 SEK




A long-standing partner of Randall Recruitment is looking for another Senior Python Developer (Python / Django / Event-Driven Architecture) to join their team as they continue to grow in Stockholm.




After recently completing a tech migration, you will get the chance to work with a modern tech stack and with a tech-team of 25 like-minded individuals.




As a company, they work with some of the biggest brands in the world and have a huge reputation in Sweden as the place to be.




With a Central Stockholm Office, the team meets in the office twice a month, with the rest being flexible / remote




Essential Tech

Python
Django
Event-Drive Architecture / Microservices




Nice To Have

High Traffic
GCP
DevOps Skillset




Must have RTW in Sweden - English Speaking Position




If you would like to know more - click apply or email josh@randallrecruitment.com

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, at csg@autorola.com or by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Paperflow, developed by Boyum IT, uses advanced AI to process invoices, credit notes, and receipts by integrating extracted data into ERP systems and workflows. By leveraging AI models, Paperflow reduces manual labour and boosts operational efficiency for businesses worldwide.




We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with production-level systems expertise. You’ll optimize and scale our document processing engine, build data pipelines, and manage end-to-end ML (training, evaluation, optimization, deployment) on cloud platforms. You’ll work closely with ML and software engineers as well as product managers to deliver production-ready solutions. Our CI/CD is based on Azure DevOps, containerization, and infrastructure-as-code for seamless deployments.




Please notice, this position requires you to be present in Copenhagen due to the hybrid type of work.







Responsibilities




Enhance and maintain our Python-based document processing engine using neural networks, heuristic rules, and post-processing.
Design and optimize Dagster pipelines to produce high-quality training and evaluation datasets.
Build ML training pipelines in Azure ML using PyTorch and Hugging Face Transformers.
Integrate third-party OCR and document processing solutions (including LLM-based) to expand capabilities.
Develop evaluation frameworks for tasks like NER, classification, similarity detection, and semantic search.
Deploy and scale models with Triton Inference Server and Azure ML.
Implement CI/CD via Azure DevOps for testing, format checks, and deployment.
Contribute to infrastructure using Kubernetes, Helm, and Bicep.
Write clean Python with type hints, maintain tests, and document methods and results.
Stay current on emerging technologies to enhance system performance.




Requirements




Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
2+ years of experience in ML, data science, or software development roles.
Strong Python, SQL, and Pandas skills.
Familiar with PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, MLflow, and data pipelines (Dagster or similar).
Experience deploying models with Triton Inference Server and working in Azure cloud.
Comfortable with Elasticsearch (semantic search via embeddings).
Proficiency with Git, Docker, Azure DevOps, and basic Infra-as-Code (e.g., Bicep).
Knowledge of Kubernetes and Helm is beneficial.
Strong communication, documentation, and collaboration skills in English.
C# or Go is a plus.




Technologies listed are guidelines; we value familiarity with related tools.




Why Boyum IT Solutions?




You will integrate an international and proudly diverse team with people originally from over 40 different countries to whom equal opportunities are given without regard to ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.
You will have a career development path that matches your personal goals and promotes a sense of belonging.
You will join a certified Healthy Place to Work in which the physical and mental health of the employees matter and are frequently promoted through internal initiatives.
You will have very knowledgeable, innovative, and helpful hands-on colleagues with a shared vision.
Your ideas are welcome, and we are committed to valuing everyone’s constructive feedback in all areas, allowing you to impact the business and the work environment in a meaningful way.
You can benefit from flexible work arrangements.
You will be part of a company that truly lives by its values linked to the “Energy for Life” motto (helping you feel energized to be with family, be social, stay fit and achieve excellence)
Join our team where we prioritize work-life balance, respecting your time both during and away from work.
Join a company committed to making a positive ESG impact through every aspect of our business.
Your work-life balance will be encouraged and respected.

#HappyTeamsHappyProjects




Ready to make an impact? Send us your CV in English – we are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t hesitate to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new developer for our AI/ML team?

AudienceProject is looking for an AI/ML focused developer for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—

Are you a curious and bright developer? And do you have an interest in AI/ML? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta and Google.

AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 60+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies and publishers in the Nordics, UK, Germany and France.

Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.

Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated developer to join our AI/ML team.

Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients.




What you will do

Our AI/ML team develops and maintains machine learning models of varying complexity, but mostly custom built deep learning solutions. As a member of the AI/ML team, you improve different products and solutions with specialized ML solutions.

Participate in all steps from data exploration to model training and evaluation, doing both engineering and modeling.
Analyze big data using Spark and Databricks to find insights and opportunities for development.
Constantly learn from the latest developments in AI/ML and potentially apply these to our products and services.
Knowledge share best practices with the other technical teams, and communicate opportunities and limitations to sales and customer success managers.
Develop production grade code in both Scala and Python.




Who you are

You are curious, bright and an independent thinker, and you like working in a team. You are passionate about AI/ML, enjoy tinkering with big data workloads and you like tackling problems with a large degree of freedom. You like challenging the assignments that you are given and understand the bigger picture and are always open to learning new things.

These are the minimum requirements to be considered for the position:

Master’s degree or equivalent experience in computer science
Familiarity with probability theory and statistical modeling
Experience with machine learning systems

These are highly appreciated:

Strong critical thinking skills
Experience with distributed systems and parallel computing
Experience with deep learning
Experience in participating in development cycles using version control and CI/CD systems
Experience from the advertisement technology industry




What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time




Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Mark Thorhauge at mt@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application.




The deadline for applications is 1st of April 2025.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Show more

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Mark Thorhauge at mt@audienceproject.com.


We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application.


The deadline for applications is 1st of April 2025.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a Senior AI/ML Consultant to lead the development of AI-powered solutions. You will design and implement machine learning models, generative AI applications, and automation tools, leveraging cloud-based architectures to drive impact for our clients.

Are you our new Senior AI Consultant?

As a Senior AI/ML Consultant at Intellishore, you will play a crucial role in shaping and implementing technology and business solutions that deliver significant value to our clients across diverse industries. At Intellishore, we are not tied to any industry, so you should thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where you will continuously learn and tackle complex infrastructural challenges. No two projects are the same!

This position offers the opportunity to dive into cutting-edge technologies while gaining a deep understanding of specific business challenges. You'll work closely with clients and collaborate with your dedicated Intellishore team to create the best solutions. Working at Intellishore means engaging with experts across multiple competencies, making each project unique and impactful.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 70 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What will be your key responsibilities?

As a Senior AI Consultant, You Will Represent The Back-end Technical Track And Take On The Responsibility For Tasks Such As


Lead the design and deployment of machine learning and generative AI applications.
Architect scalable data pipelines and AI-powered automation solutions.
Develop NLP and RAG capabilities for document processing and content generation.
Create and validate technical proof-of-concepts.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers and solution architects to ensure seamless integration.
Guide and mentor junior team members.
Provide technical expertise to clients and stakeholders.



What specific capabilities are we looking for?

As a Senior AI/ML Consultant, you should be a seasoned professional who is eager to drive impactful AI and data science projects. You should have a proven track record in building sophisticated machine learning models, working with large language models, and developing scalable data science solutions using technologies like Python and Azure.

At Intellishore, we pride ourselves on being ‘agnostic’ in the way we approach technology. This means you should be open-minded, collaborative, and excited to explore and implement new technologies and best-fit solutions for our clients.

Ideally, you match all or most of the following attributes:


3+ years of experience in machine learning and AI engineering.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.).
Experience with LLMs, vector databases, and RAG techniques.
Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and scalable infrastructure.
Strong understanding of data architecture and AI-powered automation.
Experience leading AI projects and mentoring junior engineers.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate business challenges into AI solutions.
Strong communication skills to engage with technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

 

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

A dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

 

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e., AWS & Azure)

 

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues while building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, and Iceland). This year we are going to Italy!

 

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

 

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics, and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

 

"Working at Intellishore, you get to build - not only best-practice technical solutions - but solutions that change the way people work and drive real value for companies."

Adam G. Andersen

Partner

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. We encourage you to attach a short motivational letter where you connect the dots between you and Intellishore to qualify if we should include you in the interview process. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

For more information about the position, please reach out to Sofie Freund: sfr@intellishore.dk / +45 71 54 01 08

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Engineer at Alipes Capital.

At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.

To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.

In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.

Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations

You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.

About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.

About You


Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with "out-of-core" datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask) 

Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics

 What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation

Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Pandora, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that drive impactful decisions and elevate customer experiences. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of data scientists, data engineers, and business leaders to create scalable solutions that optimize our retail operations across the full value chain – covering jewellery design and crafting, supply chain logistics, to instore/online retail and marketing. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development: Work in end-to-end analytical products, from exploration and prototyping to productizing and testing, helping to solve complex business problems across the full value chain.
Data Pipeline Engineering: Develop and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Model Deployment: Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring they are scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, MLOps engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and translate them into machine learning solutions.
Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor the performance of deployed models and implement improvements to enhance their accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research & Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.
Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of models, processes, and systems to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration.



Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.

Experience:


3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.



Technical Skills:


Strong problem-solving abilities, solid background in algorithms and data structures.
Strong proficiency in Python.
Ability to work with machine learning tools (eg. scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras, pytorch, Spark MLlib).
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).



Soft Skills:


Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.



Our Pandora Values

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
