Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We’re building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way – slow, manual, and disconnected – no longer works.

Some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies – like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io – trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you’ll do

We’re in a rare position. We’ve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now – but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We’re looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn’t about just moving tickets. It’s about solving complex, high-impact problems – owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:


Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
Solve complex machine learning challenges – especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality – using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
Serve as the team’s AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
Advocate for our work externally – writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.


This is a great fit if you…


Are an experienced backend engineer who’s built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era – especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
Have AI observability experience. AI isn’t just about shipping features that sound great – it’s about knowing, conclusively, if they’re making things better.
Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact – not as a gimmick.
Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.


This won’t be the right role if you…


Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who’s applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex – we’re AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
Struggle with ambiguity. We’re an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive – not what’s trendy. (Postgres is great.)
Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we’re a startup – this is a different kind of opportunity.


Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: £75K - £130K


Show more

Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We’re building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way – slow, manual, and disconnected – no longer works.

Some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies – like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io – trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you’ll do

We’re in a rare position. We’ve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now – but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We’re looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn’t about just moving tickets. It’s about solving complex, high-impact problems – owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:

  • Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
  • Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
  • Solve complex machine learning challenges – especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality – using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
  • Serve as the team’s AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
  • Advocate for our work externally – writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.

This is a great fit if you…

  • Are an experienced backend engineer who’s built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era – especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
  • Have AI observability experience. AI isn’t just about shipping features that sound great – it’s about knowing, conclusively, if they’re making things better.
  • Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact – not as a gimmick.
  • Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
  • Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
  • Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.

This won’t be the right role if you…

  • Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who’s applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
  • Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex – we’re AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
  • Struggle with ambiguity. We’re an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
  • Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive – not what’s trendy. (Postgres is great.)
  • Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
  • Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we’re a startup – this is a different kind of opportunity.

Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: £75K - £130K

Title: Internship: Data Scientist
Description:
Internship:
Data Scientist 

Dreaming of working with high-quality software that makes a real difference? Then seize this opportunity and apply for an internship as a Data Scientist at Systematic! 

More than just an internship 
As a Data Scientist intern, you will join our SitaWare Insight team which is part of our Defence business unit. SitaWare Insight is a decision-support tool that transforms data collection and management, providing commanders at various levels with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. The mission for the program is to simplify critical decision-making. Modern technologies like AI are used to transform data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. 

As an intern, you will play a vital role in the team, contribute to the advancement of modern technologies and be treated on a par with the other employees. Moreover, you will become an integrated part of a team from day one, receiving the professional sparring and feedback you need to succeed.  

Freedom with responsibilities 

Our new intern will get to make a real difference working with high-quality software, while you will have every opportunity to apply what you have learnt so far on your study programme. In addition, some of your daily tasks include contributing to daily advancements and developing and documenting code according to agile principles while using Python and other relevant technologies. 

In so far as possible, you will be able to plan your own tasks as we strive to create the right balance between your personal wishes, your formal study requirements and our expectations. 

You are our new intern  

… if you are studying for a BSc or MSc in Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Engineering or similar. And if you work systematically, are motivated by the quality of your work and always maintain a focus on the details. 

Throughout your internship, the focus will be on developing your competencies, which we envisage are as follows:
  

You take an interest in, are knowledgeable about or have experience with LLMs and natural language processing methods. 
You possess experience at developing or implementing machine learning models. 
You are proficient with Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers or TensorFlow.  
You are proficient in data preprocessing and feature engineering. 
You understand data handling, model evaluation, the visualisation of data-driven solutions and the development of best practices. 
You speak and write English fluently as it is our corporate language. It is also an advantage if you can speak Danish, but this is not a requirement.  



Practical information    

The internship lasts five months, starting 18th August 2025.   
The internship is a full-time position.  
When applying, please include your CV as well as your exam certificates.   
We will be assessing job applications as we receive them, as we are keen to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!    



   

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.    

    

Never stop developing     

Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.     

   

In addition to your team, you will become part of an Intern network with other Interns at Systematic, providing you with a rich opportunity to network across the organisation. You can also look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 social/professional events a year. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!    

  

Start your development here    

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Helene Overgaard Bach

Junior Consultant


Show more

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you someone who takes ownership of tasks, sees projects through with focus, and thrives on creative problem-solving? Do you enjoy uncovering patterns in data and transforming insights into actionable solutions? If you're motivated by continuous improvement and strategic thinking, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.

At PriceShape, we value collaboration and the drive to contribute to meaningful advancements. You’ll bring structure to complex problems and communicate findings to inspire action, all while contributing to the evolution of our technology and e-commerce platform.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist at PriceShape, you will play an essential role in analyzing, modeling, and deriving insights from data that drives our platform's core functionalities. You will focus on building predictive models, analyzing trends, and optimizing e-commerce-related processes using structured data.

Your day-to-day work will be together with an international team, working closely with your Team Lead, our CTO, Head of Engineering and our full-stack developers. Our department consists of colleagues from various parts of the world and English is the primary language for communication.

Your Key Responsibilities Consist Of The Following


Supporting the development and deployment of machine learning and deep learning models, contributing to the process from ideation to implementation under the guidance of the team lead.
Assisting in advanced time series analyses for e-commerce data, such as sales forecasting and inventory management.
Writing and optimizing complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Collaborating with software developers to implement data-driven solutions into the platform.
Conducting exploratory data analysis and presenting insights to the team lead and relevant stakeholders.


We Expect You To Bring The Following

Your hands-on skills and data curiosity are what matter most. We're looking for someone who is self-sufficient, eager to learn, and most importantly someone who is passionate about data science within the e-commerce space.

Must-Have Skills


Strong experience with Python and relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Scikit learn, TensorFlow…).
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries involving joins, subqueries, and aggregations.
A solid understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning) and their practical applications in sales data.
Practical experience in time series analysis for solving business problems like sales forecasting and inventory management.
Experience deploying and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment using AWS services.
Strong understanding of feature engineering techniques.
Experience with software engineering best practices such as version control and testing.


Good-to-Have Skills


Familiarity with working on sales and customer data in e-commerce.
Ability to quickly understand e-commerce-specific datasets and use them effectively
Basic knowledge of deep learning, particularly LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory networks).


What You Can Expect From Us


A great career opportunity for continuous growth alongside your team and the company.
An informal, international startup culture that prioritizes work-life balance.
Flexible working hours, with a base at our new office in Aarhus C.
Computer and equipment of your choice.
Social events like parties, poker nights, and padel tennis.


About PriceShape

PriceShape is a fast-growing company with potential for personal and professional growth. We are a young SaaS company that develops and sells a price optimization tool for e-commerce stores and brands worldwide. PriceShape has around 95 employees with our daily operations in Aarhus.

How To Apply

If you think the position is attractive and suitable, please send us a job application and your CV as soon as possible. We process and interview on an ongoing basis. For clarifications about the position, you can contact our CTO, Brian Hansen at brha@priceshape.dk.

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here. 
Who are you ideally?
You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?
Show more

We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.

Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
  • Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
  • International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.

We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.

Title: Responsible AI Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you excited about using AI to improve patients' lives? Do you thrive on crafting and delivering high-quality solutions? Do you enjoy collaborating in a dynamic, multinational environment with experts from across various domains? Then you might be interested in joining the Responsible AI Team at Novo Nordisk as a technical expert on subject matters related to responsible AI (e.g., xAI, bias/fairness assessments, adversarial training, robust machine learning, validation strategies, model monitoring, and more). This is a full-time position, primarily located in Ørestaden, with flexible working options.

Behind the title
As an AI Scientist in the Responsible AI Team, you will help ensure that Novo Nordisk is at the forefront when it comes to good machine learning practices that set patient safety and privacy at the center. As a technical subject matter expert, you will help translate legal and regulatory requirements into technical solutions, including ensuring that there are well-established technical guidelines at Novo Nordisk for how to responsibly develop and use AI. You will have a pivotal role in ensuring that the company guidelines translate into operational actions on AI/ML solutions, as well as implementing responsible AI solutions and methods on both a use-case and toolbox level. Novo Nordisk has an established process for addressing legal requirements, and you will additionally take part in some of the focus groups and expert panels that are addressing regulatory requirements around AI/ML.

Your technical expertise will be a key aspect of developing compliant, robust, and effective AI/ML products and solutions throughout Novo Nordisk.

Your key responsibilities will be:



Assist AI teams across the entire Novo Nordisk value chain with developing and implementing responsible AI techniques and/or methods in specific use cases.
Participate in developing Novo Nordisk's Responsible AI toolbox with a collection of useful techniques and tools for responsible AI practices.
Write technical guidelines for how to develop responsible and compliant AI and foster adoption throughout Novo Nordisk.
Provide technical input and expertise in the design and execution of AI Governance at Novo Nordisk, especially in the context of the EU AI Act, FDA, and EMA.
Follow research developments within the sub-fields of responsible AI.
Publish open-access research on methods or subjects within responsible AI.
Participate in conferences, activities, and talks around the topic of responsible AI both internally and externally.
You will be working with cutting-edge technology across the Novo Nordisk value chain, from new and innovative drug research to clinical trial optimization, all the way to optimizing production facilities.




Which competencies to bring?
To succeed in this role, we imagine you tick most of the following:



A master's degree with 2+ years' relevant experience, or a PhD within computer science, applied mathematics, machine learning, or a similar field.
Hands-on experience with and a strong understanding of AI technologies and their practical implications.
Technical experience within at least one sub-field of responsible AI methods and knowledge of other sub-areas.
A strong interest in how to develop robust and effective machine learning products.
An understanding of, or willingness to learn about, data privacy and AI compliance and regulation. Experience in the pharmaceutical industry is a plus.
Ability to translate complex technical and regulatory concepts into clear and actionable guidance.




You are driven by a passion to help others, and you want responsibility and freedom. You are a team player and a great listener who thrives on complicated problems.

About The Department

The Responsible AI Team at Novo Nordisk is at the heart of AI governance and compliance, ensuring that AI technologies are used ethically, transparently, and in alignment with global regulations. Our team works closely with data scientists, AI engineers, legal experts, and regulatory professionals to establish governance frameworks, technical guidelines, and best practices that safeguard AI-driven innovation across Novo Nordisk.

By joining our team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping AI policies, driving regulatory discussions, and helping Novo Nordisk maintain its position as a leader in responsible AI within the pharmaceutical industry

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that.

We are proud of our people too, and we employ more than 67,000 bright and diverse minds in 80 offices worldwide. With us, your bright mind and commitment help us change lives for people worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a seat in a rewarding and purpose-driven culture where your professional and personal development is highly valued. That said, opportunities are many in Novo Nordisk. Discover the cutting-edge technologies behind Novo Nordisk's life-changing innovations.

Not the right job for you? Explore other digital areas within Novo Nordisk.
Even if this job is not the right match for you, Novo Nordisk might still have something to offer. Our many digital teams work in various areas of technology every day – from front-end to back-end, from artificial intelligence to machine learning, and from cloud systems to quantum computing. Our digital expert make a tangible impact on lives worldwide. Want to learn more about how we do this? Go explore on Tech.life at Novo Nordisk

Contact
For further information please contact Thomas Henckel at tyyh@novonordisk.com

Deadline
3 April 2025

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Challenger Academy 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
What if you could help companies transform their businesses using AI and machine learning? Joining KPMG as a Machine Learning Engineer means you’ll be working with a variety of clients, applying the latest developments in AI to optimize operations, enhance customer experiences, and predict future trends. Take on exciting challenges from day one and shape the future of businesses with machine learning.




Perks of joining our amazing team

You will be joining our NewTech team, who drive business transformation through innovation, automation, and data-driven insights. Our team delivers impactful projects across industries, always pushing the boundaries of AI, automation, and strategic analysis to create real value for clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with a diverse team of business analysts, automation experts, and technology enthusiasts.




We foster a supportive, open culture where new ideas are encouraged and valued. Our team thrives on collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal and professional growth. Beyond work, we enjoy social events and team-building activities that strengthen our close-knit community.




What sets us apart is our relentless focus on innovation, consistently staying ahead with the latest technology in automation and AI. Through our hands-on "consulting-by-doing" approach, we provide real-world experience from day one, empowering our team to make a tangible impact while accelerating both professional development and client success.




KPMG Challenger Academy

Are you looking for a graduate programme? We think we have something better! At KPMG, you have the freedom to shape your own career. With endless opportunities to grow, learn, and take on new challenges, the KPMG Challenger Academy is where you build a future you are excited about. As part of the Academy, you set your own goals, work on interesting client projects, and get the best training to develop yourself. To make things even better, you get your own Koach (not Coach—we did spell-check this job ad, but KPMG’s equivalent of a performance manager) to help you reach your full potential and achieve your goals.




The Academy is designed for your early career after graduating your master studies. The Academy is split into 3 dynamic off-site modules, each designed to get you started in your new role and develop you as a consultant. Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or bring previous experience, we ensure that everyone starts from the same point with equal opportunities to grow professionally.




Curious to know more about the KPMG Challenger Academy? You can read much more here.




Do you recognize yourself in the following?

You have strong technical skills in building and deploying machine learning models, with a solid understanding of algorithms and data structures. Experience with Python and libraries like Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Hugging Face and LangChain, FastAPI or similar frameworks is key, and you excel at optimizing models for performance and scalability. You're familiar with cloud platforms, data pipelines, and version control using Git, allowing you to integrate models into production seamlessly. Above all, you’re passionate about AI’s transformative potential and enjoy coding, designing software and implementing ML models that make AI accessible for real-world applications.




Examples of tasks that you will do:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement AI solutions.
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning applications at scale.
Optimize model performance for real-world applications.
Integrate models into production environments using cloud platforms and Git.
Stay up-to-date and curious with emerging trends in machine learning and AI.




Are you ready to take on the challenge and become part of KPMG? Send your application today!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Mathias Hoeg Boisen mhboisen@kpmg.com or on phone +45 51 16 11 77.




We are excited to receive your application. The deadline for applying is 13 April or as soon as we have found our new team member. This might be before the final deadline since we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis.




Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.




At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




We can’t wait to hear from you!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here. 
Who are you ideally?
You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our development team is searching for an enthusiastic and dynamic AI Engineer to join our newly established AI team. This is a fantastic opportunity to be at the forefront of our latest product development, integrating AI as a key component to enhance our solutions. If you're excited about AI, prompt engineering, and developing next-generation AI-powered solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Joining Configit offers you a unique opportunity to thrive in a dynamic and ambitious company, working alongside highly skilled colleagues. As an international, multicultural software company, we operate across offices in Denmark, Germany, the US, the UK, and India. While this position is based at their headquarters in Copenhagen, you can expect collaboration with colleagues across these locations.

We are currently undergoing a transformative journey, transitioning from a traditional license-based software company to a cutting-edge subscription-based SaaS vendor. Specializing in innovative software solutions, we cater to manufacturing companies dealing with complex products, including those from renowned brands like Jaguar Land Rover, Philips Healthcare, and Siemens. Collaborating closely with clients and partners, we take pride in resolving complex configuration challenges and shaping the future of configuration software.

Your role

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and implementing AI-powered solutions within our products. Your key responsibilities will include:


Being the subject matter expert and go-to person for AI’s technical landscape and emerging AI technologies
Designing and refining prompt strategies for AI models, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and optimal system responses
Gaining an in-depth understanding of our product suite and leveraging AI to enhance user experience and functionality
Working with a wide variety of AI technologies, such as ChatGPT, and Claude to develop and deploy AI-driven features
Collaborating closely with developers, product owners, and tech leads to integrate AI in a meaningful and scalable way
Continuously iterating and optimizing prompts and AI workflows to improve automation and decision-making processes
Exploring and implementing new AI techniques and methodologies to drive innovation within the company
Contributing to the overall AI strategy, ensuring alignment with our long-term product goals


Your Skills

To succeed in this role, you should have a good technical foundation combined with a passion for AI and emerging technologies. Specifically, we are looking for someone who:


Has hands-on experience with AI solutions that are actively deployed and operational
Has a good technical understanding and is comfortable working with complex software products
Has experience or deep interest in prompt engineering and how to refine AI interactions for optimal performance
Has applied experience with LLMs and understands their strengths and limitations
Is familiar with AI solutions such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, LLaMA, or Mistral.
Has a natural curiosity and enthusiasm for AI and new technologies, always eager to experiment and refine AI-powered solutions
Enjoys working in cross-functional teams, collaborating with software developers, product owners, and AI specialists
Has experience or a good understanding of manufacturing or production industries (not mandatory but highly beneficial)
Is fluent in English with strong communication skills


What You’ll Find With Us

A unique opportunity in a dynamic, ambitious, and international culture, where you will work with a lot of skilled colleagues.


We are proud of our values: Business Focus * One Team * Knowledge * Can do Attitude * Move Fast
We work with complex and challenging products that add great value to our enterprise customers.
We offer a flexible working policy, which ensures a healthy work-life balance in a flexible setup.
Collaboration is important, and we work in an international environment and across all professional disciplines.
We prioritize communication as an important part of our culture, which is informal and open on all levels.
We offer a high-standard office environment in Copenhagen close to public transport.


At Configit, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can thrive. We are proud to employ people of all backgrounds, and your unique talents and experiences will be welcomed. Come be a part of an exciting team!

We are supported by Coresearch in this recruitment.


Show more

What’s in it for you?

International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. Who are you ideally?
You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior AI Engineer – PUFIN ID
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At PUFIN ID, we’re on a mission to protect brands and consumers from counterfeit threats by bridging the gap between physical products and the digital world. Since 2019, we’ve been building cutting-edge AI-driven solutions that assign every product a unique digital twin. Our proprietary technology leverages image recognition and rapid similarity search across vast datasets, ensuring authenticity and security in the digital economy.




This is an opportunity to be at the forefront of AI innovation, working with a deep tech company where AI is at the core of everything we do. As a Senior AI Engineer, you will be the domain expert leading our AI strategy, ensuring robust, scalable, and efficient AI systems. You will work closely with a highly skilled team of ML specialists, DevOps engineers, and software developers, shaping the future of our AI-driven security solutions.




Responsibilities

Develop, test and deploy deep learning and computer vision algorithms
Develop and optimize ML pipelines, ensuring efficient data handling, model training, and deployment
Manage the entire ML codebase across development, staging, and production
Oversee the ML lifecycle, including model monitoring, data drift detection, and model retraining
Lead the research and development efforts of new algorithms and techniques for model optimizations, synthetic data generation and more
Contribute to data management, ensuring data quality and availability for model training and evaluation




Qualifications




You bring

More than 3 years of experience in AI system design, implementation, and scaling
Expertise in MLOps, including model deployment, monitoring, and automation in production (we use AWS)
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in PyTorch, ClearML, and Poetry (or similar tools)
In-depth understanding of neural networks for image recognition and experience in computer vision
A track record of successfully implementing and managing end-to-end ML pipelines, from data collection to model inference




Soft Skills That Make You Stand Out

Ownership: You thrive in a role where you can take initiative and own the AI system end-to-end
Problem-Solving Mindset: You enjoy tackling complex challenges and finding scalable solutions
Collaboration & Communication: You work well with cross-functional teams and can explain AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Adaptability & Curiosity: You are always eager to learn, improve, and push the boundaries of what’s possible




What We Offer

A high-impact role where you will be responsible for the full AI solution in a fast-growing deep tech company
A collaborative, international work environment with experts in AI, ML, DevOps, and software engineering
Competitive salary and opportunities for professional growth
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
The chance to be part of a 15-person startup on the verge of international scaling




If you’re passionate about AI-driven security, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are eager to take ownership of an innovative ML platform, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and be part of our journey to redefine digital authentication.

Show more

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.
Who are you ideally?
You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.

Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?
Show more

  • Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.

We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.

The question is: Are you in?

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
