Title: Data Scientist til Fraud Detection & AI Solutions
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kan du dykke dybt i data? Har du styr på Machine Learning-modeller, SQL og Python? Og vil du arbejde med landets mest interessante datagrundlag? Så er du den Data Scientist, vi søger til afdelingen Fraud Detection & AI Solutions.

Vil du være med til at fremtidssikre velfærdssamfundet med teknologier som ML, NLP og Computer Vision?

I Digital Solutions får vi velfærden til at fungere. Vi spiller en afgørende rolle i digitaliseringen af det danske samfund, fordi vi står bag de systemer, der får to ud af tre velfærdskroner ud til danskerne.

Her er vi lige nu på udkig efter en Data Scientist til afdelingen Fraud Detection & AI Solutions, hvor vi bl.a. sikrer en koordineret indsats i forhold til kontrol af fejludbetalinger og snyd med offentlige ydelser.

Derudover spiller vi en vigtig rolle i arbejdet med effektivisering af forretningens processer ved brug af teknologier som Machine Learning, NLP, Computer vision og lignende teknologier. Siden sidste år har vi kortlagt et (kæmpe)stort NLP-potentiale på tværs af ATP, og nu arbejder vi på at udvikle og implementere løsningerne, så vi sikrer en effektiv udbetaling.

I jobbet som Data Scientist er det mere konkret dig, der:


Forstår forretningens behov på tæt hold For at udvikle de bedste løsninger er det vigtigt at forstå forretningens behov. Derfor kommer du til at arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige teams for at afdække deres behov og omsætte dem til datadrevne løsninger.
Udvikler avancerede modeller i Python Du er med til at udvikle statistiske modeller i Python, der er baseret på Machine Learning ved brug af både træningsdata og unsupervised metoder.
Vedligeholder og monitorerer vores modeller For at sikre, at vores modeller fungerer optimalt, bliver du ansvarlig for løbende monitorering og vedligeholdelse. Her holder bl.a. øje med, hvorvidt modellerne opfører sig som forventet og tilpasser dem efter behov.
Er med fra udvikling til produktion Vi arbejder med best practices fra softwareudvikling for at gøre overgangen fra udvikling til produktion så gnidningsfri som muligt. Du er derfor med til at sikre, at vores løsninger bringes sikkert fra udvikling til produktion i vores scrum-setup.
Udvikler og implementerer NLP-løsninger Sidst, men ikke mindst, kommer du til at spille en central rolle i udviklingen af NLP-løsninger og sørger for, at de bliver produktionssat og taget i brug af vores interne kunder.


Har du styr på SQL og Python?

Der kan være flere veje til rollen som Data Scientist, men vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant kandidatgrad inden for matematik, statistik, fysik, computer science, ingeniørvidenskab eller lignende. Hvis du har et par års erfaring, er det en fordel.

Derudover er du:


erfaren når det kommer til dataanalyse og udvikling af Machine Learning-modeller
en haj til Python, SQL og lignende (en fordel, ikke et krav)
med til at skabe resultater i samarbejde med andre
god til at finde enkle løsninger på komplekse udfordringer.


Vil du være en del af et unikt it-fagligt fællesskab?

I Fraud Detection & AI er vi en del af enheden Data i Digital Solutions. Vi brænder for data og de muligheder, data kan skabe. Som landets største udbetalingshus administrerer ATP to ud af tre velfærdskroner i Danmark.

Vi arbejder med et unikt datagrundlag, som giver os særlige muligheder – både for at lave dybdegående analyser og for at udvikle datadrevne løsninger.

Du bliver en del af en afdeling med mere end 40 dygtige kolleger, der arbejder som Data Scientists, Software Developers, Data Analysts og forretningsansvarlige. Du kommer især til at arbejde tæt sammen med afdelingens dygtige tekniske specialister, som arbejder med Data Science og softwareudvikling i full-stack-løsninger.

Vi arbejder i et fagligt stærkt miljø, hvor vi deler viden og hjælper hinanden med at udvikle os – både teknisk og personligt.

I ATP er barren sat højt, både når det gælder ambitioner og trivsel. Vi tror på et arbejdsliv i balance. Det kræver fleksibilitet med plads til den enkelte - og det har vi.

=dig? Så send os dit CV

Du behøver ikke sende os en lang ansøgning. Vi er mere interesserede i dit CV, som du skal sende senest søndag den 23. marts. Når du sender dit CV via vores system, får du mulighed for kort at beskrive din motivation for at søge stillingen.

I ATP arbejder vi for en fair rekrutteringsproces, og derfor beder vi dig om ikke at vedhæfte billede i dit CV eller angive din alder, når du søger.

Vi behandler henvendelser løbende og håber på opstart hurtigst muligt. Du kan læse mere om rekrutteringsforløbet her: https://www.atp.dk/rekrutteringsforloeb-i-atp .

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte sektionschef Lene Blak Rasmussen på mail lru@atp.dk. eller på tlf. 40 12 89 21.

Til annoncører, search- og rekrutteringsbureauer: ATP frabeder sig venligst uopfordrede henvendelser vedrørende annoncering af stillingsopslag og kandidater fra headhuntere og rekrutteringsbureauer. Vi ønsker heller ikke at modtage uopfordrede henvendelser vedrørende salg af tjenesteydelser og produkter i forbindelse med jobopslag. Vi beder om, at dette ønske respekteres, og at rekrutterende leder og andre medarbejdere ikke kontaktes i denne henseende.


Show more

  • en haj til Python, SQL og lignende (en fordel, ikke et krav)
  • med til at skabe resultater i samarbejde med andre
  • god til at finde enkle løsninger på komplekse udfordringer.

Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.
Show more

Responsibilities:


  • Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
  • Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
  • Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.


Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:


  • Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
  • Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
  • Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
  • Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
  • Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
  • Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
  • Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
  • Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
  • Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.


We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:


  • Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
  • Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
  • Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
  • A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
  • Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.


If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: Join Deloitte as a Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

With more than 3000 employees Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, and Technology & Transformation.

Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent or soon-to-be graduates, who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.

About The Team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team-players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation – and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!

Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software developer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.

Job Description

As a software developer at the Engineering offering, you will work with many different aspects of development, from writing code to testing it. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common for all of them are that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.

In this role, you will make an impact by:


Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops and sales pitches and contributing to proposals for new client projects.


Qualifications

You hold or will hold a Master’s degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Development. Perhaps you have experience from previous part- or full-time software development positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set. Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:


Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Some experience with modern DevOps practices such as CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and test automation.
You have strong analytical skills and a focus on quality and detail.
You are a positive-minded teammate with the ability to work and solve problems in a structured way.
You can communicate and express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.


Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.

What we can offer you:

We highly appreciate the knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring, and in exchange, we make sure they develop professionally, meet their career goals, and enjoy their time with Deloitte. Therefore, other than an incredible social calendar, we offer our consultants:


Enrollment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey in Deloitte.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.


On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to festivals – not to mention the yearly Trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. Additionally, we have a strong sense of belonging and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote personal and professional development.

Additional Information

Do you want to be part of our team?

Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.

Send your application, CV, and other relevant documents by 09.05.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.

Expected start date: 01.09.2025.

Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.

We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

We look forward to connecting with you!

In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.
Show more

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27380

Are you ready to help shape the future of AI & Generative AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team?

The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Data Management focusing on delivering and enabling generative AI use cases across the organisation. The unit provides reusable AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

We are now looking for an Expert Data Scientist who is interested in working in the field of Generative AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, ML engineers, and business stakeholders to take AI and Generative AI applications from concept to production, ensuring they are developed in an ethical, safe, and sustainable way.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Applied Data Science team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

What you will be doing:


Design and build scalable, reliable AI solutions, using existing assets or creating something new from scratch
Ensure our Generative AI applications are developed from idea to production, meeting all necessary requirements for smooth and successful deployment
Design and build internal and reusable AI Assets and Services to leverage in multiple use case development projects, accelerating its time to market
Integrate our systems with external tools, like vector databases, LLMs, and AI services. Your work will make sure everything plays nicely together!
Stay on top of cutting-edge technologies by exploring and recommending the latest and greatest AI tools and services. Your insights will keep us ahead of the curve!


Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other´s growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving, and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire people to take action


Your experience and background:


BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant technical field
10+ years of experience in testing, maintaining, launching AI/ML products, working with MLOps best practices and DevOps environment (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, container orchestration)
Experience in training, evaluation, fine-tuning and deployment of predictive models; including feature selection, hyper-parameter tuning, error analysis and data visualisation
Experience in Generative AI (Large Language Models, Embeddings Models, building RAG and agentic solutions)
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, generative AI (e.g., AWS Bedrock), ML (e.g., AWS SageMaker), or data storage services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, engaging explanations—whether you're presenting to a technical team or breaking things down for non-experts


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 23/03/2025 . We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com .

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Pandora is the World’s largest jewellery brand, known for affordable luxury, innovative design and our high-quality craftsmanship. Founded in 1982 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by Per Enevoldsen and his wife Winnie, Pandora started as a small jewelry shop and has since grown into the globally recognized brand it is today.

At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience by leveraging our vast data combined with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented MLOps Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As an MLOps Engineer at Pandora, you will play a play a critical role in deploying, monitoring, and optimizing machine learning models in production environments. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between our AI Team and our Data Platform engineers, ensuring the seamless integration of ML models into scalable and reliable systems. In this role you will design and implement robust MLOps pipelines, automate model training and deployment processes, and monitor the performance of ML systems, including systems for GenAI. Your expertise in cloud platforms, containerization, and CI/CD tools will drive the operational efficiency of our AI and machine learning initiatives. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, maintenance, and scalability.
Automate the retraining, testing, and validation processes for ML models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, software engineering and DevOps, to integrate ML models into production systems.
Monitor model performance, diagnose issues, and implement improvements.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance of ML systems in production.
Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining high system performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.



Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience:
Solid experience as a MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.
Technical Skills:
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code frameworks and languages (Terraform, Bicep or ARM)
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.

Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more

    • Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
    • Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
    • Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
    • Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
    • Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
    • System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
  • Soft Skills:
    • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
    • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
    • A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.
Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Data Science Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SYBO is part of the Miniclip family and known for the widely popular game, Subway Surfers - the most downloaded mobile game in the world, with over four billion downloads. Located in the heart of Copenhagen, we aim to create playful moments that inspire our fans to care.

We are looking for a talented Data Science Intern to join our Analytics team for 3 to 6 months. During this time, you will get the chance to dive into the exciting world of mobile gaming, to help us enhance our data understanding and innovate within our team.

If you are passionate about data, proactive and have a problem-solving mindset, we would love to have you onboard.

This internship is unpaid and full-time running for the fall semester in 2025.

Your time at SYBO

In your ramp-up month - During this time, you will get the opportunity to experience being part of a real analytics team and your first step will be discovering the gaming industry, SYBO and how our analytics team operates.

In your contributor months - After this discovery period, you will be working a comprehensive investigation into a real gaming data problem with the help of the team. With this project, you will get the opportunity to enhance the game knowledge and provide concrete inputs on how to improve it.

Responsibilities


Your role will lie in applying your analytical skills & creativity to large datasets.
You will be looking for optimisations to contribute to the game performance.
You will get the freedom to propose new ideas, and present them to stakeholders within the company.


Requirements


Experience in a programming language such as Python or R Studio, as well as basics in SQL
Experience with data handling (data collection, cleaning, autonomous exploration etc.)
Understanding of statistical analysis


It is a requirement to be enrolled in a university program that supports a full-time internship as part of the education - and you need to be able to commute to our Copenhagen office on a daily basis.

We do not offer relocation, VISA, or house search assistance for internships.

About SYBO

We're SYBO, the mobile games studio behind the legendary Subway Surfers, with over 4 billion downloads worldwide! Join our team in the heart of Copenhagen, where creativity flourishes in our new, innovative studio.

If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to dive into engaging and creative projects alongside a diverse group of collaborative colleagues from over 40 countries across the globe.

We truly believe you perform your best, when you have the equipment you need - and our IT team is always there to ensure you have access to the latest tools and the right gear, enabling you to be at your best.

We also pride ourselves in taking care of your well-being, offering a delicious lunch buffet, a variety of healthy snacks, and regular social events to keep the energy flowing.

SYBO is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants, regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Junior Consultant - AI & Automation
Description:
The life sciences industry plays a significant role in advancing healthcare and improving the quality of life - in many cases, saving millions of lives globally. At BASE life science, this is the motivation for everything we do, aimed at pushing boundaries, seeking excellence, and making a lasting difference through consulting expertise and data-driven solutions.




Who is BASE life science?

Founded in 2007, BASE life science is a business and technology consulting enterprise working exclusively in the life sciences industry.




From our headquarters in Denmark and offices in France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States of America, we serve customers across the globe. With a deep understanding of the life sciences industry, we work hand in hand with customers to identify, develop, and implement strategic initiatives that drive growth, efficiency, and overall success through tailored solutions.




Our partnership with industry-leading solution providers, including Veeva, Salesforce, IQVIA, Benchling, and MediSpend ensures that our clients harness the full potential of the most innovative solutions on the market.




About the role

Are you a passionate student in STEM eager to apply your skills in solving real-world challenges?




BASE life science is looking for 3-4 driven STEM students, currently in their 3rd year of undergraduate or 1st year of a master’s program, to join our AI and automation team on a part-time basis. This is a unique opportunity to work on innovative proof-of-concept projects within the life science industry, dedicating 12-20 hours per week with flexible scheduling around your exams. We are looking for the team to span the capabilities of a data scientist, data engineer and software developer.




As part of a small, dedicated unit, you will gain hands-on experience with a multitude of different technologies. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to interact with project managers, life science consultants, data scientists, cloud engineers, and software engineers across the globe, accelerating the development of state-of-the-art proof of concepts for the Life Science industry.




The right candidate will also get the opportunity to work directly on customer projects. This is a great opportunity to gain practical experience in cutting-edge technology and contribute to innovative projects in the Life Science field.




As a Junior Consultant your responsibilities include:

Develop and improve AI solutions and products we deploy at our customers.
Design and develop new innovative solutions together with our Life Science consultants that bring value to the Life Science Industry.
Collaborate with our Cloud and Software Engineering teams to set up cloud services and develop production-grade solutions.




We offer this position in Copenhagen, Denmark.




What makes you the best person for this job?




To be successful in this role, you have the following competences:

Experience developing software or performing data science tasks in Python.
Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Java and bash).
Experience or a keen interest in working with LLMs (OpenAI/Google) and generative AI.
Great problem-solving skills.
Work with complex problems in a structured way and being a part of a team.
Ability to communicate complex problems in a concise manner.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.




What makes us the best employer for you?

BASE life science has been recognized as an outstanding workplace, earning us the Great Place To Work certification in Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom.




We are proud to represent 35+ nationalities among our colleagues, and firmly believe in the power of diverse perspectives and characteristics to drive truly innovative solutions and achieving excellence.




At the heart of our organization lies a foundation grounded in five core values: team spirit, trust, openness, ambition, and execution. We cultivate an environment that champions flexibility, placing confidence in our employees to successfully complete tasks while upholding a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we place significance in cross-functional collaboration, where niche skills and specialisms are valued and challenging the status quo is encouraged.




Additionally, we offer you:

Health insurance.

Remote work friendliness.

Ongoing learning and development.

Flexible schedules to fit your work to your routine.

Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.

Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.

The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.




Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.




By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Ongoing learning and development.

Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.

Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.

The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.


Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.


By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du arbejde med machine learning i et strategisk højt prioriteret miljø, hvor AI-udvikling er i fokus? Lederne søger en Senior Data Scientist, der vil tage del i at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger og samtidig fungere som teknisk sparringspartner for forretningen. Her får du frihed under ansvar, muligheden for at fordybe dig i de nyeste teknologier og et team af dygtige specialister, der deler din passion for data.




Hvem er vi?

Lederne er Danmarks største interesseorganisation og a-kasse for ledere. Vi er i gang med en digital transformation, hvor AI og data står centralt i at skabe de bedst mulige løsninger for vores mere end 135.000 medlemmer. Eksempelvis har vi allerede udviklet flere AI-baserede værktøjer, der bygger på kendte LLMs.




Din rolle som Senior Data Scientist

Som Senior Data Scientist hos Lederne får du en nøglerolle i at:

Designe, udvikle og drifte vores ML-platform og AI og automatiserings-løsninger.
Tage ejerskab over og definere retningen for, hvordan vi arbejder med AI efter best practice.
Opdage nye forretningsmuligheder i tæt samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af organisationen.




Du får altså en bred rolle, hvor du både koder, drifter og udvikler modeller og derudover inspirerer din omverden til at se nye AI-perspektiver.




Dine ansvarsområder

I tæt samarbejde med forretningen og AI, Data & Cloud-teamet får du ansvaret for at:

Designe, udvikle og produktionssætte ML-løsninger på vores dataplatform (Snowflake, DBT, Azure m.m.).
Vedligeholde, optimere og videreudvikle data pipelines med fokus på robust drift og høj datakvalitet.
Eksperimentere med nye AI-teknologier (f.eks. GPT) og validere proof-of-concepts, herunder lovgivning og etik.
Sikre tydelig formidling af dataindsigter og AI-potentiale til forretningen.
Overvåge modellernes performance og løbende forbedre vores ML-infrastruktur gennem feedback og faglig sparring.




Teamet omkring dig

Du bliver en del af vores AI, Data & Cloud-team, der består af 8 data- og analyseeksperter. Heraf er tre (inkl. dig) Data Scientists. I teamet får du kolleger, som går op i nørdet vidensdeling og sætter en ære i at hjælpe hinanden til succes. Hele teamet vil selvfølgelig hjælpe dig med at komme godt i gang, og generelt er samarbejde og særligt faglig sparring en stor del af vores tilgang til arbejdet. Du vil have direkte reference til chefen for AI, Data & Cloud.




Er du den rette?

Vi søger en profil med stærk teknisk forståelse, en hands-on-mentalitet og evnen til at sikre høj kvalitet. Vi ønsker at anvende nye og relevante teknologier til arbejdet med Data Science, og den rette kandidat er derfor dig, der er naturligt nysgerrig og har lyst til at lære nyt. Du har gerne nogle års erhvervserfaring og er klar til at tage skridtet videre til Senior. Det vigtigste er, at du besidder et stærkt drive, er ansvarlig, selvkørende men samarbejdende og tilgår dit arbejde metodisk og struktureret med øje for detaljer.




Dine kvalifikationer:

Solid erfaring med programmering i Python og SQL.
Dokumenteret erfaring med ML-frameworks og værktøjer.
En stærk forståelse for statistiske metoder og modellering.
En akademisk baggrund fra f.eks. DTU Compute, Cand.scient.dat., Cand.it., MSc i Data Science eller en tilsvarende kvantitativ uddannelse.
Du taler og skriver dansk på et professionelt niveau, da en stor del af vores data og forretningsdialog foregår på dansk.




Hvis du har erfaring inden for ML, AI-teknologier og cloud-platforme (AWS, Azure, GCP) samt med at teste, vedligeholde og lancere AI/ML-produkter, er det et stort plus, men det er også noget, dine kommende kolleger gerne lærer fra sig. Måske har du stiftet bekendtskab med Docker, Git, Azure Cloud samt Snowflake og dbt, men det er ikke afgørende.




Vi tilbyder:

Muligheden for at sætte et unikt aftryk på Ledernes digitale transformation.
Kort vej fra idé til prototype eller MVP på vores Data Platform.
Et højt specialiseret data- og AI-team med masser af plads til sparring, eksperimenter og fordybelse.
En dynamisk organisation med 400 ansatte og mere end 135.000 medlemmer.
En uformel kultur, der vægter samarbejde, faglig udvikling og work-life-balance.
Syv ugers ferie, sundheds- og tandlægeforsikring, sportsaktiviteter, kantineordning fra Meyers (inkl. takeaway), massageordning m.m.
Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen.
Kontor på Vermlandsgade 65, 2300 København S – let at nå på cykel eller med offentlig transport.




Lyder stillingen som noget for dig?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, så send dit CV (uden billede) til os, og inkluder 3-5 linjer om din motivation for stillingen. Vi opfordrer dig til at ansøge hurtigst muligt og senest mandag d. 7. april, da vi afholder samtaler løbende. Skulle vi finde det rette match, inden ansøgningsfristen er udløbet, forbeholder vi os retten til at lukke stillingen.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du altid velkommen til at kontakte Chef for AI, Data & Cloud, Mathilde Loft, på e-mail: mlo@lho.dk.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more

  • Tage ejerskab over og definere retningen for, hvordan vi arbejder med AI efter best practice.
  • Opdage nye forretningsmuligheder i tæt samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af organisationen.


Du får altså en bred rolle, hvor du både koder, drifter og udvikler modeller og derudover inspirerer din omverden til at se nye AI-perspektiver.


Dine ansvarsområder

I tæt samarbejde med forretningen og AI, Data & Cloud-teamet får du ansvaret for at:

  • Designe, udvikle og produktionssætte ML-løsninger på vores dataplatform (Snowflake, DBT, Azure m.m.).
  • Vedligeholde, optimere og videreudvikle data pipelines med fokus på robust drift og høj datakvalitet.
  • Eksperimentere med nye AI-teknologier (f.eks. GPT) og validere proof-of-concepts, herunder lovgivning og etik.
  • Sikre tydelig formidling af dataindsigter og AI-potentiale til forretningen.
  • Overvåge modellernes performance og løbende forbedre vores ML-infrastruktur gennem feedback og faglig sparring.


Teamet omkring dig

Du bliver en del af vores AI, Data & Cloud-team, der består af 8 data- og analyseeksperter. Heraf er tre (inkl. dig) Data Scientists. I teamet får du kolleger, som går op i nørdet vidensdeling og sætter en ære i at hjælpe hinanden til succes. Hele teamet vil selvfølgelig hjælpe dig med at komme godt i gang, og generelt er samarbejde og særligt faglig sparring en stor del af vores tilgang til arbejdet. Du vil have direkte reference til chefen for AI, Data & Cloud.


Er du den rette?

Vi søger en profil med stærk teknisk forståelse, en hands-on-mentalitet og evnen til at sikre høj kvalitet. Vi ønsker at anvende nye og relevante teknologier til arbejdet med Data Science, og den rette kandidat er derfor dig, der er naturligt nysgerrig og har lyst til at lære nyt. Du har gerne nogle års erhvervserfaring og er klar til at tage skridtet videre til Senior. Det vigtigste er, at du besidder et stærkt drive, er ansvarlig, selvkørende men samarbejdende og tilgår dit arbejde metodisk og struktureret med øje for detaljer.


Dine kvalifikationer:

  • Solid erfaring med programmering i Python og SQL.
  • Dokumenteret erfaring med ML-frameworks og værktøjer.
  • En stærk forståelse for statistiske metoder og modellering.
  • En akademisk baggrund fra f.eks. DTU Compute, Cand.scient.dat., Cand.it., MSc i Data Science eller en tilsvarende kvantitativ uddannelse.
  • Du taler og skriver dansk på et professionelt niveau, da en stor del af vores data og forretningsdialog foregår på dansk.


Hvis du har erfaring inden for ML, AI-teknologier og cloud-platforme (AWS, Azure, GCP) samt med at teste, vedligeholde og lancere AI/ML-produkter, er det et stort plus, men det er også noget, dine kommende kolleger gerne lærer fra sig. Måske har du stiftet bekendtskab med Docker, Git, Azure Cloud samt Snowflake og dbt, men det er ikke afgørende.


Vi tilbyder:

  • Muligheden for at sætte et unikt aftryk på Ledernes digitale transformation.
  • Kort vej fra idé til prototype eller MVP på vores Data Platform.
  • Et højt specialiseret data- og AI-team med masser af plads til sparring, eksperimenter og fordybelse.
  • En dynamisk organisation med 400 ansatte og mere end 135.000 medlemmer.
  • En uformel kultur, der vægter samarbejde, faglig udvikling og work-life-balance.
  • Syv ugers ferie, sundheds- og tandlægeforsikring, sportsaktiviteter, kantineordning fra Meyers (inkl. takeaway), massageordning m.m.
  • Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen.
  • Kontor på Vermlandsgade 65, 2300 København S – let at nå på cykel eller med offentlig transport.


Lyder stillingen som noget for dig?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, så send dit CV (uden billede) til os, og inkluder 3-5 linjer om din motivation for stillingen. Vi opfordrer dig til at ansøge hurtigst muligt og senest mandag d. 7. april, da vi afholder samtaler løbende. Skulle vi finde det rette match, inden ansøgningsfristen er udløbet, forbeholder vi os retten til at lukke stillingen.


Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du altid velkommen til at kontakte Chef for AI, Data & Cloud, Mathilde Loft, på e-mail: mlo@lho.dk.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Unsolicited application
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you looking for a student job, an internship or a full-time position that is currently not posted, please submit you application here.

And can you envision your future in a leading tech-driven company with the framework to create tomorrow's sharpest audio solutions?

Then come join our team!

Shure has an ambitious goal of offering our customers an exceptional high-end audio performance in our broad range of products. In Copenhagen, we design and develop high-end audio products and advanced software solutions that are used in a wide range of integrated audio systems of contexts from small meeting rooms to large business environments. In that respect w e are always on the outlook for talented colleagues to join our great team.

At Shure, we appreciate collaboration, commitment, and innovation as well as a natural interest in solving complex issues. We strive towards achieving extraordinary results and we are not afraid of taking on challenging tasks. We are a tech-driven company in the process of implementing SAFe. But even though we work in sprints, we are not rushed. For us, arriving at the right solution is more important than quick workarounds.

In Copenhagen, we are 45 developers, and we collaborate with colleagues in Chicago, Edinburgh and Hyderabad to develop the best solutions for Shure's broad portfolio of audio products, so we can offer our customers products of exceptionally good sound quality.

Below please find examples of some of the engineering disciplines we have in Copenhagen:

Responsibilities

Application Software

Here we are working with HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript as well as frameworks such as Angular and MaterialDesign, you can help develop great functionalities to Shure’s growing portfolio of software applications. You will work close with our talented full-stack developers.

DevOps

You can help us to delivery faster by automating repetitive tasks. In DevOps, we help teams deliver firmware, software and data by streamlining our build set-up. We use Jenkins, Git (bitbucket), Python 3.4+, Linux and Docker, PostgreSQL and Windows, and we visualize data using Grafana which enables our colleagues to make data driven decisions.

Embedded Software

If your passion lies within C, C++ and Python, you will contribute to the development of new product features and solutions including task estimation, design, implementation and documentation. Our embedded software team spans the globe, and you will be part of a knowledgeable team of professional developers.

Digital Signal Processing

Within Digital Signal Processing, you will be working within design, simulation, development, and test of real time audio signal processing algorithms for fixed and- floating-point DSPs. Also, you will be making simulations in Matlab and Simulink as well as using C and C++.

System Verification In System Verification, we test by using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning will give you the opportunity to explore the impact of using algorithms to effectively test a software product. You will help improve better test coverage, test accuracy, visualize performance metrics and visual verification using Python, Selenium and Kibana.

Qualifications

Our value proposition to you We are a company of passionate and dedicated people who are happy to share experience and learn from each other. W e see product development as a team effort. In essence, our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our Associates.

You will become part of an inspiring and flexible workplace with a dynamic work environment and great colleagues that value, support and respect one another. We believe in the value of a good work-life balance and do our outmost to ensure that our employees thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.

We offer you an exciting and challenging job with ample opportunity for learning and growth, flexible work arrangements as well as an attractive compensation package reflective of your experience and qualifications.
Show more

Title: Data Enablement Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Role Overview

As a Data Enablement Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.

Specifically you will support internal teams’ adoption of the platform, creating reusable patterns, documentation, and providing consultative support for complex use-cases. You should expect that the role will involve a lot of hands-on data engineering (co-engineering/peer programming) initially.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Initially, handle building the first set of stream/batch processing pipelines and reusable patterns to bootstrap self-service adoption.
Develop documentation, templates, blueprints, examples, and reference implementations for analysts and developers.
Conduct onboarding, training sessions, workshops, and ongoing enablement.
Support software developers and analysts when they face complex scenarios or edge cases.
Gradually shift from initial ownership to advisory/support as internal users gain maturity and autonomy.




Technical Experience

Stream Processing & Data Engineering:
Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Apache Beam
Experience in building and optimizing streaming/batch pipelines (transformations, aggregations, joins, enrichments).
Data Modeling & Schema Management:
Schema Registry, Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema, schema evolution practices.
Data modelling (star-schema, OBT, semantic)
Analytical & Operational Use-Cases:
Understanding of analytical data use-cases, real-time dashboards, or operational applications.
Exposure to SQL and analytical tools (Databricks SQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau).
Exposure to DBT
Documentation & Communication:
Experience producing technical documentation, user guides, tutorials.
Strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely to varied audiences (analysts, engineers, managers).




Nice-to-Have

Proactive, customer-centric mindset—actively identifying user needs and gaps.
Excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate closely with internal users.
Experience delivering training sessions, workshops, or technical presentations.
Comfortable providing guidance and mentorship in complex situations.




Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Developer Advocacy roles.
Past experience in an enablement, consulting, or advisory position strongly preferred.
Demonstrated track record of improving adoption and maturity of self-service data platforms.
Show more
