Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Morgan King Technology are partnered with a fast growing Nationwide company looking for a Senior Software Engineer based in Leeds. We're looking for someone who has an expertise in Django, Django Admin, and MySQL to join a dynamic team. If you have a passion for writing clean, scalable code and optimising backend systems, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!




Location: Leeds, UK

Job Type: Full-Time




What You’ll Be Doing:

Designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance Django applications.
Creating efficient, user-friendly administrative interfaces using Django Admin.
Optimising and maintaining MySQL databases, ensuring top performance and reliability.
Writing clean, scalable, and well-documented code that adheres to best practices.
Managing authentication, authorisation, and security within Django.
Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior engineers.
Optimising database queries, indexing, and schema design for maximum efficiency.
Ensuring effective implementation of CI/CD pipelines.
Troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues in both production and development environments.




What We’re Looking For:

5+ years of professional experience working with Django and Django Admin.
Strong experience with MySQL databases, including performance optimisation, query design, and migrations.
Proficiency in designing RESTful APIs and integrating third-party services.
In-depth knowledge of ORMs, database indexing, and query optimisation.
Experience with Celery, Redis, and task scheduling.
Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, or cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Familiarity with unit testing, debugging, and performance tuning.
Proficiency with version control systems (Git, GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket).
Experience with asynchronous processing in Django.




Nice to have:

Experience scaling high-traffic applications.
Knowledge of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.




If you’re a Senior Software Engineer who thrives on solving complex technical challenges and optimising backend systems, we’d love to hear from you! Drop us a message or apply now to learn more.




#MorganKingGroup #Hiring #Django #MySQL #SoftwareEngineer #LeedsJobs #TechJobs

Title: Junior Web Developer
Description:
Junior Web Developer




Location: Leeds




Salary: Competitive




Job Type: Full-Time in office (Hybrid after 6 months)




Are you a passionate Junior Web Developer looking to grow your skills in a dynamic and fast-paced agency? My client is looking for a talented developer to join our team, working alongside the Web Development Manager and wider agency team to support an exciting portfolio of clients.




About the Role

In this role, you'll be responsible for developing and maintaining PHP-based event websites while also building live campaign events for a diverse client base. We’re looking for a motivated and adaptable individual who can work independently and collaboratively within a team.




This is a fantastic opportunity for a full-stack developer with a strong front-end focus. You'll receive full training and ongoing support from the Web Development Manager to help you develop your technical skills and progress in your career.




Key Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and optimise high-quality websites and web applications.
Write clean, maintainable, and reusable code following best practices.
Work as part of an agile, fast-moving team, contributing to project success.
Take ownership of projects from concept to completion.
Ensure websites are fully optimised for performance, SEO, and cross-browser compatibility.




What We're Looking For

Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Basic knowledge of PHP and MySQL.
Experience using GitHub for version control.
Understanding of SEO best practices.
Familiarity with Photoshop and Adobe Creative Suite.
Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and responsive design principles.




Benefits

Competitive salary
20 days holiday + bank holidays
Excellent working environment
Pension scheme
Ongoing training and development opportunities




This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career in web development while working on exciting projects for a variety of clients.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Senior Developer

Leeds Area (Flexible Working)

£70k + 10% Bonus




The Senior Developer is a key member of the development team and integral in providing excellence in our software offerings. The role is for an experienced software developer who delivers technical excellence and is able to not only follow best practices but also look for improvements to our processes. You will have an in-depth understanding of the entire software development lifecycle working in an Agile environment and be able to assist with technical design decisions. You will ensure that our software solutions not only meet but exceed industry standards and our clients' expectations.




Responsibilities




Software Development:

Develop cutting edge software solutions to support the company objectives.
Identify areas of innovation/ improvements to our products.
Promoting a culture of collaboration with other members of the team.
Providing mentorship to less experienced members of the team, support with recruitment and training when required.




Development Processes:

Follow and identify improvement areas to our software development processes.
Be a key member of the Agile development team, championing the ways of working and our Scrum adoption.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders across departments to derive and define software requirements.
Collaborate with the Lead Developer to ensure that software is functional/ performant and meets its requirements.




Technical Oversight:

Ensure technical decisions are robust, scalable, and in line with the strategic vision of the client.
Remain updated with the latest industry trends, incorporating best practices and technologies into our solutions.




Quality Assurance:

Work closely with the software testers to ensure work is completed and tested within the agreed deadlines.
Uphold the highest standards in software quality through rigorous code reviews, testing protocols, and documentation practices.
Oversee software releases, ensuring they are of impeccable quality and reliability.




Collaboration:

Work closely not only with the immediate Agile team, but also with other teams such as Support/ Marketing/ Client Services to ensure our software meets their needs.
Support the Development Director/ Lead Developer if necessary.




Qualifications & Experience

5+ Years experience of software development, ideally using Python, Modern Javascript frameworks in an Agile working environment (Scrum or Kanban).
Comprehensive knowledge of the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
Proficiency in modern software languages, tools, and frameworks relevant to our operations.
Excellent communication skills.




Desirable Attributes:

An innovative, forward-thinking approach.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
Ability to handle high-pressure situations and prioritize multiple tasks.
A genuine passion for technological advancements and continual learning.




Technical:

Python (Flask/FastAPI)
Vue js or other Javascript frameworks
Microservice architecture
C#/ Java or other Object Oriented programming language experience (nice to have)
Jira/ Confluence or other project managemet tools.
MySQL/ SQL Databases & ElasticSearch & Redis
Rabbit MQ
Linux
REST/GraphQL
Ansible
Prometheus/Grafana/Alertmanager

  2. Identify areas of innovation/ improvements to our products.
  3. Promoting a culture of collaboration with other members of the team.
  4. Providing mentorship to less experienced members of the team, support with recruitment and training when required.


Development Processes:

  1. Follow and identify improvement areas to our software development processes.
  2. Be a key member of the Agile development team, championing the ways of working and our Scrum adoption.
  3. Collaborate closely with stakeholders across departments to derive and define software requirements.
  4. Collaborate with the Lead Developer to ensure that software is functional/ performant and meets its requirements.


Technical Oversight:

  1. Ensure technical decisions are robust, scalable, and in line with the strategic vision of the client.
  2. Remain updated with the latest industry trends, incorporating best practices and technologies into our solutions.


Quality Assurance:

  1. Work closely with the software testers to ensure work is completed and tested within the agreed deadlines.
  2. Uphold the highest standards in software quality through rigorous code reviews, testing protocols, and documentation practices.
  3. Oversee software releases, ensuring they are of impeccable quality and reliability.


Collaboration:

  1. Work closely not only with the immediate Agile team, but also with other teams such as Support/ Marketing/ Client Services to ensure our software meets their needs.
  2. Support the Development Director/ Lead Developer if necessary.


Qualifications & Experience

  1. 5+ Years experience of software development, ideally using Python, Modern Javascript frameworks in an Agile working environment (Scrum or Kanban).
  2. Comprehensive knowledge of the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
  3. Proficiency in modern software languages, tools, and frameworks relevant to our operations.
  4. Excellent communication skills.


Desirable Attributes:

  1. An innovative, forward-thinking approach.
  2. Excellent analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
  3. Ability to handle high-pressure situations and prioritize multiple tasks.
  4. A genuine passion for technological advancements and continual learning.


Technical:

  1. Python (Flask/FastAPI)
  2. Vue js or other Javascript frameworks
  3. Microservice architecture
  4. C#/ Java or other Object Oriented programming language experience (nice to have)
  5. Jira/ Confluence or other project managemet tools.
  6. MySQL/ SQL Databases & ElasticSearch & Redis
  7. Rabbit MQ
  8. Linux
  9. REST/GraphQL
  10. Ansible
  11. Prometheus/Grafana/Alertmanager

Title: Researcher
Description:
Researcher – Raw Selection

Location: Leeds, UK

Salary: £25,750.00 to £30,000.000

1st Year expected OTE £35,000 to £60,000 | 2nd Year expected OTE £50,000 - £65,000




Join Raw Selection – One of only two GENUINE executive search firms in Leeds




Raw Selection is a specialist executive search firm based in Leeds City Centre, that works exclusively with Private Equity firms and their Portfolio companies.

We undertake searches for CEO, CFO, COO appointments and private equity professionals mostly for positions in the United States of America.

Our Founder, Alex Rawlings, built Raw Selection with one clear goal—to be the No.1 executive search firm in Private Equity. To make that happen, we need high-performance individuals who are hungry for success.

If you are happiest researching, have high attention to detail and most of all want a career where you build genuine skills, this is for you. Join our established Research function and be rewarded heavily for your efforts and “make serious money”.




What’s in It for You?




✅ Earning Potential

Our top performer on the research team earns in excess of £60,000+ per annum with only 3 years of experience.

✅ Career Acceleration

Whether your ambition is management, business leadership, or becoming the best at your profession, we will actively help you achieve that.
A clearly documented career pathway.

✅ High-Performance Culture

We push each other to be the best and win as a team.

✅ Industry-Leading Training

Industry-leading internal and external training platforms, including daily training from senior leaders, weekly training from an external trainer and monthly sessions from Seventh Wave.
Learn from some of the highest-performing consultants in Yorkshire.
Training in Boolean to X-ray searching and following our intensive 17-step process for sourcing the very best talent.




The Mission

The mission of the Researcher is to identify the very best executives, then assess those executives through our proven interviewing process.




Sourcing Executive Talent

Identifying:

Researching via our CRM, online platforms and data aggregators.

Phone interviewing the world’s leading executives and private equity professionals, following our interview process, and identifying high performing executives.

What We’re Looking For

✔️ High attention to detail – You will love researching and getting into the detail.

✔️ Resilience & Grit – Recruitment is tough. You need to bounce back and learn from setbacks.

✔️ Exceptional Communication – You’re confident and articulate

✔️ Self-Starter Mentality – You take initiative, work hard, and figure things out.

✔️ A Desire to Be the Best – You want to dominate your space and take in our industry leading training.




Ready to Launch Your Career in Executive Search?

If you’re ready to earn big, develop fast, and become an expert in research within executive search, we want to hear from you.

📩 Apply now or send your CV and a short intro to Ami.Wilson@Raw-Selection.com

🚀 Your future starts here.

Title: Web Developer
Company: Better Placed Ltd - A Sunday Times Top 10 Employer!
Description:
Web Developer (Shopify)

West Yorkshire (hybrid, once a week, once a fortnight options are available)

£35,000 -£55,000 + bonus




This company’s growth over the last few years has been some of the fastest I’ve ever seen in West Yorkshire. With revenue doubling year on year and topping £100m they’re looking to expand their internal tech function with a Frontend focussed Shopify Developer.




This is a real fast-paced ecommerce environment where you’ll be working side by side with an experienced Shopify team to fix, improve and own the website. There’s a roadmap laid out that will involve some fascinating work bringing things inhouse and using the latest AI ecomm tools.




This role would suit a solid mid-level developer or a junior wanting to step up that wants the autonomy and support to make impactful decisions on the best ways of running a high revenue website.




They require someone who is going to drive things forward and constantly search for improvements as they aim to double revenue again this year.




Skills required/ tech you’ll be using:




Shopify/ Shopify Liquid experience
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, modern frontend frameworks
REST API experience
Frontend focussed role
Ability to work quickly, fix things, add things and bring value
Have worked with 3rd party agencies




The company is going from strength to strength, with varied and interesting work to get stuck into. It’s a fantastic opportunity to work on a high revenue Shopify site and solve the problems they face.




There’s also a very competitive bonus structure on offer as well as flexible hours.




If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, apply with your CV or reach out to Ben Greensmith

Title: Java Product Developer
Description:
Who We Are

AND Digital are a tech company focused on accelerating digital delivery and dedicated to closing the digital skills gap. We've been helping organisations build better digital products and stronger digital teams since 2014.

We believe our work should always leave a legacy for the client. We do this through close relationships with our offices (or ‘Clubs') so that our partners are always prioritised by a regional team close to them.

This unique model has driven success for our clients and ourselves, evidenced by our remarkable organic growth since 2014. Today we number more than 1,300 people with Clubs all over the UK and Europe with plans for global expansion in the next couple of years.

Join us - and help us fulfil our mission to close the world's digital skills gap.

What You'll Bring To The Table


Solid development experience working in a commercial environment, a good understanding of Java or similar (e.g. C#), Typescript and Angular, and wider experience in different tools and frameworks and across the stack.
Knowledge of AWS or another cloud product set (e.g. GCP or Azure)
An enthusiasm for broadening your skillset and learning new technologies
Commercial experience working with agile methodologies.
Experience dealing with challenges from stakeholders on technical issues and influencing technical decisions in the team.
Understanding and ownership of best practice as a Senior Engineer (eg. TDD, SOLID, XP)
Experience of guiding and supporting junior and mid-level engineers.
Working knowledge of CI/CD practices and deployments.
Experience of writing effective documentation and knowledge sharing.


Why join AND Digital?

We have three values: wonder, share, and delight. These values inform how we work with clients, and our culture: what it feels like to work for AND. We believe collaboration, ambition, curiosity and fun can drive innovation by creating a better environment for problem-solving.

By Joining AND, We'll Provide


Opportunities to work on projects with big clients and the chance to produce meaningful work that makes a difference to people's lives.
A "Blended Working" model, meaning you will be able to work in a range of locations from; your home, in your clubhouse, on a client, as well as just a change of scenery.
A dedicated career scrum team, designed to help you reach your career goals and develop the skills you need to be your best self.
Monthly and quarterly team socials - on us - ranging from after work drinks, to driving experience days with your fellow club members.
A safe environment for you to be yourself and challenge yourself.


Equal Opportunities

At AND Digital we embrace diversity and are committed to equal opportunities. We are actively recruiting for a diverse and inclusive workforce so want to ensure we do everything we can to support your application.

We want you to feel safe and empowered to let us know if you require any adjustments to be made to your application or interview process so please speak to our recruitment team.

Title: Python GCP Data Applications Developer
Description:
We are looking for a Python GCP Data Applications Developer to join our team. This hybrid role offers flexibility to be based in either Bradford or Leeds. You will be expected to work in the office at least two days a week.

Join our Technology and Product Development team to build innovative cloud-based data and technology-driven back-office products using Google’s AI offerings. You will leverage your Python and data skills to develop data processing pipelines and Generative AI applications in the cloud

What will you be doing?


Meet business requirements and collaborate with the team to build solutions.
Participate in product technical architecture design, focusing on data and AI.
Collaborate with the broader Technology and Product team to ensure exceptional service standards.
Maintain a close relationship with the group security team to ensure compliance of all products and services.


Essential

We tend to look for people with:


Demonstrable experience in Python.
Demonstrable experience in data engineering in the cloud.
Background in building data applications in GCP.
Comfortable working with solutions and products written in Python, SQL, and Docker.
Experience with version control solutions such as GitHub, including branching, merging, and pull requests.


Preferred


Data engineering experience.
Experience with Terraform and Bash.
Familiarity with Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence.


What’s in it for you?


Competitive salary + bonus
25 days annual leave with the option to purchase 5 more
Access to wellbeing and mental health benefits such as the Calm app, personal medical, critical illness cover and dental insurance
Matched pension contribution up to 10%
Access to our car benefit scheme
Access to our online learning platform to continue to develop and grow your career with us
The chance to join an innovative, fast-paced and passionate team


Who We Are

Liberty Blume, a Liberty Global company, is a rapidly growing business services provider, specialising in tech-enabled back-office solutions. Our mission is to deliver efficiency, scale and value to our customers through Business, Procurement and Financial Solutions. If you’re curious, customer centric and enjoy being one step ahead, join us on our scale up journey and unlock your freedom to grow!

Liberty Global is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive environment and accommodating all candidates. We’re eager to hear from you, no matter your background.

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
SEEKING: Backend Developer for a Software Company based in Leeds!

Approach: Hybrid.

Salary: £60,000 DOE

Do you want to join a growing company making waves in their industry?




The successful Backend Developer will be responsible for the server side of our web applications acting as part of a small, yet fast-paced team.




As the Backend Developer, you will have hands-on experience with object-oriented methodologies in PHP and have an ability to write, optimise and execute SQL queries to extract reports from large datasets.




You must have an understanding of HTML5/CSS3/JQuery technologies, W3C web standards and accessibility guidelines in UX.

PHP
SQL
W3C Standards
HTML5, CSS3

URGENT ROLE IMMEDIATE INTERVIEWS FAST OFFERS




My client is hiring due to growth which demonstrates the opportunity for career progression. Additionally, my client offers fabulous benefits too!

Title: Researcher
Description:
As a people advisory firm, we know how incredible the impact can be when you have great people in the right roles. It’s why we focus on hiring and developing brilliant people for our clients – and for ourselves.




We’re now looking for a Researcher to join our Executive Search Team. You will have high levels of drive and a commitment to excellent delivery and first-class customer service and want to further your career with a high quality professional search team.




What we are looking for

We are looking for a Researcher who has previously worked in executive search, ideally specialising in the industrial market. Responsibilities will include:




Utilising a variety of tools to identify first-class candidates for our team of Consultants.
Assisting Consultants in the day-to-day management of assignments working with both candidates and clients.
Work with Consultants to prepare presentations for client presentations/pitches
Prepare long-list and short-list reports to send to clients
Attend client meetings, interviews and other relevant meetings with Consultants
Build target list of candidates/sources for current and future assignments.




Based in our central Leeds office, occasional travel will be required to our London Office and client sites across the UK.




Remuneration

We offer an attractive salary and bonus scheme and benefits package, personal development, career opportunities and an excellent, high growth working environment.

Title: Elixir - Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Elixir - Senior Software Engineer

Location: Hybrid, travel to Leeds 1-2x per monthRemote

Salary: £65,000 per annum

Why Apply?

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Software Engineer to join a rapidly growing SaaS company. This permanent role offers the chance to work on cutting-edge web applications using Elixir, LiveView, JavaScript, CSS frameworks and AWS - with the opportunity to gain exposure to much more.

This is a superb role with someone with existing Elixir experience or an aspiring functional software engineer who has a passion & interest to learn this tech stack.

Senior Software Engineer Responsibilities

Development & Deployment: Design, build, and maintain scalable, secure web applications using Elixir, LiveView, Elm, and JavaScript.
Frontend Development: Create intuitive user interfaces, ensuring responsive design and optimal user experience using CSS frameworks like Tailwind.
Data Visualisation: Develop interactive and insightful data visualisations for data-driven decision-making.
Code Reviews: Maintain high-quality standards through thorough code reviews and constructive feedback.
Performance Optimisation: Identify bottlenecks and implement solutions to improve application performance.
Infrastructure & DevOps: Deploy and maintain applications on AWS, leveraging services such as ECS, Lambda, and AWS CDK for scalable infrastructure management.
Collaboration: Work alongside product managers, designers, and engineers to deliver new features and application updates.
Mentoring: Support junior team members with guidance and technical mentorship.
Continuous Learning: Stay informed on industry trends and best practices to drive innovation in software development.

Senior Software Engineer Requirements

Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software engineering, with at least 3 years in web applications, ideally within a SaaS environment.
Strong programming skills in JavaScript and modern frameworks or libraries.
Knowledge of functional programming languages such as Elixir, or Haskell, Scala, Erlang. Lisp, F#, PureScript or Python is highly desirable.
Expertise in CSS frameworks, particularly Tailwind, to create responsive designs.
Experience with data visualisation tools like D3.js or HighCharts.
Solid understanding of NoSQL databases such as MongoDB; experience with Data Lakes or BI query engines is a plus.
Proficiency in AWS services including EC2, SQS, ECS, Lambda, and CodePipeline.
Ability to design and implement modern, user-friendly interfaces that prioritise accessibility and usability.

What's in it for me?

Competitive salary of £65,000 per annum.
Flexible working hours with remote work options.
Professional development opportunities in an innovative and supportive environment.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

  • Infrastructure & DevOps: Deploy and maintain applications on AWS, leveraging services such as ECS, Lambda, and AWS CDK for scalable infrastructure management.
  • Collaboration: Work alongside product managers, designers, and engineers to deliver new features and application updates.
  • Mentoring: Support junior team members with guidance and technical mentorship.
  • Continuous Learning: Stay informed on industry trends and best practices to drive innovation in software development.

Senior Software Engineer Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software engineering, with at least 3 years in web applications, ideally within a SaaS environment.
  • Strong programming skills in JavaScript and modern frameworks or libraries.
  • Knowledge of functional programming languages such as Elixir, or Haskell, Scala, Erlang. Lisp, F#, PureScript or Python is highly desirable.
  • Expertise in CSS frameworks, particularly Tailwind, to create responsive designs.
  • Experience with data visualisation tools like D3.js or HighCharts.
  • Solid understanding of NoSQL databases such as MongoDB; experience with Data Lakes or BI query engines is a plus.
  • Proficiency in AWS services including EC2, SQS, ECS, Lambda, and CodePipeline.
  • Ability to design and implement modern, user-friendly interfaces that prioritise accessibility and usability.

What's in it for me?

  • Competitive salary of £65,000 per annum.
  • Flexible working hours with remote work options.
  • Professional development opportunities in an innovative and supportive environment.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Title: Accessibility Tester
Description:
Contract Accessibility Tester / Outside IR35 / West Yorkshire







Are you an experienced Accessibility Tester looking to drive improvements and ensure WCAG compliance across a range of platforms.




What do we need from you?

Extensive experience in accessibility testing across multiple assistive technologies, including but not limited to JAWS, Dragon, ZoomText, Axe DevTools, and Wave.
Strong knowledge of WCAG 2.1 AA standards and best practices.
Hands-on experience with tools such as ARC Toolkit, Axe DevTools, Wave, and screen readers (JAWS, NVDA, etc.).
Ability to provide clear, actionable feedback to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.




What can you expect?

Opportunity to act as the Accessibility SME, advising on best practices and compliance improvements.
Conducting thorough accessibility testing and providing actionable recommendations.
Collaborating with development and design teams to ensure WCAG AA compliance.
Documenting findings and assisting in implementing improvements.
A fast-paced contract role in a supportive and technically driven environment.




What’s in it for you?

3-month initial contract with potential for extension.
Outside IR35 engagement.
Hybrid/Remote options available – West Yorkshire-based role.
The chance to drive accessibility improvements and ensure compliance for a leading organisation.




If you’re passionate about accessibility and looking for your next contract opportunity, we’d love to hear from you!




To apply, send your CV to Dom Brown at d.brown@corecomconsulting.co.uk by Wednesday 12th March. Interviews are taking place shortly, so don’t miss out!

Title: Developer
Description:
We work with some of the UK’s biggest companies and government departments to provide a pragmatic approach to technology, delivering bespoke software solutions and expert advice.

This is a hands-on, client-facing role, offering the opportunity to be involved in the full development lifecycle. You’ll typically work in small, tight-knit multidisciplinary teams, solving tough software problems. This is a great opportunity to develop your career and progress quickly, working closely with highly skilled colleagues in a supportive environment.

Skills

We’re looking for passionate, proactive technologists. We are technology agnostic and use the right language, tooling and frameworks for the job. We’re open minded when it comes to your existing skillset, but we value the following:

What are we looking for?


Proficiency in at least one of Python, Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript or TypeScript, and their associated ecosystems.
You’re a problem-solver, pragmatically exploring options and finding effective solutions.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative approach to work.
You embrace the chance to try new things, learn new skills and grow your experience.


What You’ll Get In Return Is


25 days’ annual leave, rising to 30 days with each year of service.
Generous family leave policies.
Access to an employer pension scheme, private medical services and Group Life Assurance.
A range of optional benefits such as discounted gym membership and a cycle-to-work scheme.
A meaningful approach to evaluating your performance and providing feedback on your progress.


At Scott Logic, we value the flexibility of remote working alongside the value gained from spending time with our colleagues and clients. In our offices you’ll find employee-led clubs and events, as well as free games, books, and refreshments.

We have shared values that govern our behaviour toward others and the environment. We are proud to be a B Corp, a global movement of businesses driving for a more inclusive, equitable, and regenerative economy.

We believe diversity drives innovation, and embrace a culture where everyone can contribute, irrespective of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability.
